description:
~Food~  
Burrata: It's peach season so the Burrata came with peaches and it was soo delicious. Burrata was soft, creamy, and spreadable. Peaches were lightly tangy and balanced out the honey. Perfect balance between the cheese and fruit.
Meatballs & Polenta: Meatballs came out piping hot so watch your tongue. It was juicy and went well with a scoop of polenta.
Mt. Lassen Trout: It's a little smaller than I thought but it was very filling. Juicy, not too salty, and the lemon emulsion wasn't as in your face as a traditional fresh lemon squeeze. 

~Price/Quality/Quantity~  
We came during HH, which cut down the price of the appetizers (burrata & meatballs) by a little. Total was $57+tax/tip and even though it was only 3 dishes, it was filling (prob from all the delicious carbs). I prob wouldn't say the $34 trout is worth it but I love this place for their appetizers. Come for HH.

~Atmosphere/Service~
Staff greeted us immediately and overall attentive. It can get a little loud in there during HH but overall still an intimate atmosphere. 

~Bottom Line~
Must get the Burrata.
author: Lily L.

description:
Came here with a friend for lunch and it was overall okay.

Food wise, the burrata was phenomenal! The combination of sweet and savory was just delicious. 10/10 recommend! I ordered the tomatoes and cucumber salad with yogurt (starter) and it was okay. I wouldn't order it again. As for our main dishes, I had the salmon and I was not super impressed. The top coat garnish was good, gave it a lot of flavor. But the rest of the salmon was just "eh". The beans and veggies that came under the salmon were also okay, the sauce in which they were cooked with was okay as well. My friend ordered the halibut and he said it was now the second time he'd ordered it, it was really good according to him. Looked good!

We both got a taste of a white wine the waiter suggested (cannot remember the name) and it was really really good. I've yet to find a white wine that I really like as I'm a red wine kind of gal, but this one was definitely a good one! I remember the waiter mentioning it was from the north of Italy, a little town which had the name on the bottle. 

Now the service. The service was great! Our waiter was super kind, very attentive and knew his recommendations well. I appreciate a waiter that knows what he's talking about and doesn't just give off random suggestions or the "well everything is pretty good". The manager (gentleman walking around in a suit) was very kind as well. Always had a smile and was courteous.

All in all, pretty good experience. Knocking down 2 stars because for the price of the meals, it could have honestly been a lot better.
author: Karina R.

description:
When I first walked into Credo, I immediately noticed the good vibes in the place. Combined with the modern setting (quotes on the walls), Credo is an excellent place to go out for a night bite. 

The menu also has a very good selection. Unfortunate as it is, my taste buds could not enjoy my starter because of the vinaigrette but that is of course personal preference. Yet what was delicious was my steak and the breaded tomatoes which came with it. The chef was clearly meticulous about preparation and judging by look alone, I would give all dishes 10/10. 

Once again, in such a restaurant as Credo, I can only rave about the service and they went beyond their purview to recommend some other trendy restaurants. I would definitely recommend this place for a night out!
author: George W.

description:
Came to San Francisco to check out the new transit mall and meet up with our son. Credo was very close to all. I have been doing the WFPB aka vegan eating for some time now. I contacted the restaurant through the Yelp app and the responded fast. They mentioned about 4 items off the menu and said other items could be tweaked too.

When we arrived Brandon greeted us and confirmed that we had a vegan in our party.

The menu was not over whelming, drinks on one side and food the other.
I ordered the zucchini papparadelle for the table to share, it was thinly sliced zucchini, tomatoes, squash blossoms and garlic. I could eat that one all day.
For my main dish I had the pizza with no cheese and add mushrooms.

I was going to add more info about ingredients on pizza but was unable to access the menu on line.

The wife had a burrata cheese and shrimp dish.
Son had a salad that had strawberry in it and a pasta dish that was covered with pizza dough. Both were happy with selections.

We were to full for desert

Also, our waiter was great to explain how the dishes were prepared and ingredients.
author: Don F.

description:
Great restaurant. 

The wine- we had a bottle of Saini Zinfandel and it was a solid Zinfandel. Much better than their son by the glass.

Food- Burrata didn't disappoint- but I usually like bursts. 
Halibut - so GOOD. Nice, light, fresh dish. I highly recommend
The "pasta pot pie" - original dish with a pizza crust   Yummy pasta and sauce inside

Service- great service. Wait staff was attentive and friendly.
author: Courtney M.

description: Pork sugo good as always. The others got the pasta pizza dough dish and thought it was solid. For apps we got the meatballs which were yummy
author: Laura D.

description:
I enjoyed a nice dinner at Credo this past weekend (5/19/18). Four of us gathered for an early meal and found the restaurant  to be very pleasant since it was quiet enough to hold a conversation.

What I liked about Credo was the fact that there were a lot of food options for any appetite and craving. Bonus: the restaurant starts you off with delicious complimentary levain bread & butter.

After reading other Yelp reviews I decided we should start off with the octopus plate as our shared appetizer. Gotta say that not only was the plate very pretty to look at but also incredibly tasty. Definitely I could have had this all to myself as an entree since the vegetables, potatoes and octopus together was delicious.

My companions (who all seemed focused on carbo loading) ordered pastas: pappardelle with pork sugo, linguine & clams and cavatelli with chicken breast. They seemed happy with their dishes and gobbled up the pasta in record time.

My choice of pork chop as entree, unfortunately, was the only disappoint. The meat was undercooked and was quite pink near the bone so I couldn't eat it. Otherwise the accompanying sides of sauteed red cabbage (somewhat sauerbraten-like) and disks of baked/ grilled sweet potato were yummy.

Since one of our party was celebrating a birthday, we were about to order dessert but were pleasantly surprised when our server brought out a slice of cake with a lit candle on a plate. How thoughtful & what a nice surprise! The cake was a house-made cherry blossom essence sponge cake with whip cream on the side. Very light and was a good way to round out the meal.

Overall, I liked Credo restaurant. The decor was very pretty; the quiet weekend ambiance relaxing for the group; and food was satisfying. Hope to return to try other dishes in the future.

Btw: Credo in Italian means "I believe" and this is the start of all the quotes on the artfully designed wall space.
author: Joanna T.

description: I've been wanting to try an actual dinner at this restaurant for a long while. Finally, several Friday's ago, I enjoyed dinner with a colleague. We shared the burrata with stone fruit and crostini. And it was delicious! Our main course was Sedanini, Penne, Fennel Sausage, Mozzarella, Tomato Sauce, Pizza Crust. Another fabulous to choice. I would venture to say that we couldn't have gone wrong with any entree. We enjoyed Huckleberry Punch (Square One Basil Vodka, Huckleberries, Lemon, Ginger Beer).  What a delicious cocktail! The ambiance is intimate. The quotes all over the walls are uplifting. I just want to read the walls. The service was excellent. I'll definitely be returning.
author: Danielle S.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaurants now. I got the saffron clam linguine, which blew my expectations out of the water - the linguine was clearly handmade, the clams were extremely fresh and lined with huge round meat, and the saffron broth is rich without being overwhelming. 

If you have room in your wallet/stomach for dessert, I'd also recommend the affogato. The crunchy cocoa nibs add pizzazz and the frosty vanilla bean gelato at the bottom made me a very happy child. This place is definitely a little pricey, but it's a great meal.
author: Laura C.

description:
Credo makes me want to take back every 5 star I have ever given, because the bar has been raised!

What an amazing dining experience. Came here after attending a Yelp event with Credo and was thoroughly impressed. I've walked by many a time and never came in. So glad I finally did.

FOOD: The food was all amazing. We had the meatballs with polenta (yum yum yum), the octopus (most tender octopus we've ever had), the pizza crust pasta, squash blossom pizza, and New York steak. WHATA MEAL! Highlights were the meatballs, octopus, and steak. Soooo good. If you love octopus, get this get this. It was melt-in-your-mouth good. I love polenta and meatballs, and these were so flavorful and light. Apparently they take 3 days to make, and you can tell how much love goes into them. The steak was perfectly cooked (medium rare for me), and the fried green tomatoes on the side were so flavorful.

SERVICE: We adored our waiter, Tim. He was honest and helpful, ensuring we had the best wine to go with our meal. and that everything was to our liking. Really great guy! General service was also great- our water glasses were never empty, and they didn't take our empty plates until we were BOTH done eating. Call me traditional, but this is important to me when dining at a nice restaurant.

PRICE: I thought prices were very fair. For 3 courses each + wine, we paid $200. And we were beyond stuffed (2 courses would have been fine). Great serving sizes and endless bread!

Overall, I think this place is an absolute gem. Not only is the food delicious and well thought-out, but the serving staff is an absolute delight. I want to spend every night dining here! Wonderful experience. Thanks Credo!
author: Hannah S.

description: Super Tasty! The Burrata was my favorite, I could come back every now and then for some more authentic food like that!
author: Mary L.

description:
We were a party of 8 who came here for my friend's birthday dinner. Ordered three bottles (two Cab's, one Pinot) shared some appetizers, and each ordered either off the Mids or Mains. Summary is that I really like this restaurant's ambiance and hosting, but found the food to be more on the mediocre side. Also, I would peg this place as $$$ rather than $$.

Comments on the ambiance/hosting: Really wonderful.  When you walk in here, you wonder if it's going to be a stiff, high-end restaurant, but it is SF after all, so the hostesses were classy but relaxed. My kind of vibe. 5/5

Comments about the menu: 

Bread + butter: This stuff was simple, but delicious. Who doesn't appreciate soft butter + fluffy, moist sourdough? We ordered two rounds of this bread and had no shame. 5/5 

Crostini, Lardo, Summer Figs, Arugula, Villa Manodori: My friend doesn't eat red meat so we ordered this with the lard on the side. I ate the crostini w/out the lard anyway, and found that it was actually terribly bland. 3/5 Wouldn't recommend, but then again I opted out of the pork fat. 

Pork & Ricotta Meatballs, Polenta: This was pretty decent, but I thought for the size of the meatballs that it was overpriced. Didn't really tasted anything besides the ground pork. Tomato sauce was average. 3/5 

Burrata, Roasted Stone Fruit, Wildflower Honey, Toasted Levain: This was pretty good. Burrata was creamy and generously served. 4/5 

Saffron Linguine, Clams, Stewed Tomatoes, Chili Butter: I gotta admit, I didn't really taste the saffron here. It was more like light, clam-based cream broth than anything. Not very memorable, unfortunately. 3/5
author: Julia Y.

description:
Things that count:

Fresh amazing ingredients
Orchestrated in such a way that your salivary glands will combust

Fast polite service

Amazing amazing cucumber salad w pickled tomatoes and ...***tarragon***...the grace...and dill yogurt dressing
I die for u

Red velvet heaven!!!!

I'll see u again
author: Apple J.

description:
Everything about this meal was exceptional, from ambiance to flavor, and especially service. There is a downstairs section where you can be seated but is usually reserved for special events; if you're looking for a more romantic session, as to be seated here. We had the pleasure of meeting Brandon, who helped us decided final selections for the evening. 

We started with the Pork and Polenta Meatballs, which were delicious. And with the delicious bread that was served table side, we cleaned the plates of any remaining sauce.

Next up was the Ricotta Gnocchi, Charred Eggplant, Summer Squash, Tomatoes, Pesto, Ricotta Salata. This was delicious but thankfully my date devoured the majority of it as it is a very large portion.

For our mains, we were brave and each got our own, which while I don't regret, it was a very ambitious decision. 

I has the Mt. Lassen Trout, English Peas, Sea Beans, Favas, Fingerling Potatoes, Lemon Emulsion. It was very filling but tasted so light and fresh.

My date had the Sedanini, Penne, Fennel Sausage, Mozzarella, Tomato Sauce, Pizza Crust, which is served in what I can only describe as a personal Dutch oven with the "toppings" cooked within and the pizza crust covering the top like an pizza shepherd's pie. It was pretty fun and tasted great.

For dessert, my date got the Goat Cheese Mousse, Chamomile, Fresh Strawberries, Sonoma Honey, Crystalized Basil. It was a perfect balance of the sweet and tart and was a unique experience. 

I got the Chocolate Ganache Tart, Hazelnut Brittle, Chocolate Meringues, Nutella Crumbs, Salted Caramel, Grand Marnier Sauce. The chocolate meringues tasted like lucky charms marshmallows (a compliment). The combination of everything was very rich, so beware, but it was absolutely spectacular.
author: Amirissa M.

description:
Everything about our meals was fresh and creative. We started with the Burrata and warm olives. The Burrata was fresh and would highly recommend. I had the Ricotta Gnocchi which was tasty and full of flavor.

They are good for large groups with the basement seating which has the ambience of good sayings written over the wall. Their service is very good and professional.

Picture of the Ricotta Gnocchi.
author: Soumen B.

description: Solid food, pleasant casual setting. The prawn appetizer was delicious, but the gnocchi were just okay. Definitely a decent choice if you're staying in the area and you want something nice/casual.
author: Oriane G.

description: Outstanding Italian Food, service, ambiance, fair pricing and the servers are very friendly and attentive to detail.   The wine selection was very nice.  I had to sit at the bar as I didn't have a reservation and the place was packed.   Unlike a lot of spots, sitting at the bar was a great experience.    I was treated as well as anyone sitting at the tables.   This place is first rate, all the way.
author: Mark C.

description:
Came for lunch with my beautimous babe friend, but really should have brought a sumo wrestler and a lumberjack - portions are gargantuan!

We had so much food (for ladies that lunch, that is!) 

Started with octopus, roasted root vegetables, and prawns - we really should have stopped there. Even this was too much. These were so delicious. I liked the way they worked this. No diggity. So I bagged it up. 

We had both agreed to order the "Tarte Flambee" pizza as our main to honor both of us (me being the tarté one, of course) before realizing how big the starters were. This was topped with pancetta and creme fraiche- found this to be much lighter than actual white cheese. 

My friend also had the pappardelle, and I looked away once and by the time I was back she had devoured it. I think she liked it. 

Great wait staff - and they even offered us a complimentary  dessert. Unfortunately, it wasn't a chocolate wheelchair to wheel me out so I had to decline. 

I would return - apparently there's huge private event space downstairs. Would be fun to throw a party or 10 here.
author: Spartevan V.

description:
This place was good overall. A few positives:

1. It was my birthday and they sang happy birthday and served cake for free!
2. The service was great. Our waitress was very nice and well-informed on the menu.
3. They have a great secluded table if you have a large party. It was nice being away from everyone else.
4. The bread and the butter is AMAZING. The butter has this salty taste to it, which I really enjoyed. I couldn't stop eating it.

But, I have a few negatives:

1. It's very political. I'm fine with a few quotes here and there, but playing speeches in the bathroom is a bit much for me.
2. It's incredibly expensive. $20 for a glass of wine?!
3. The food was so-so. It wasn't amazing, but it was OK.
author: Remy B.

description:
Great lunch and dinner menus. I usually come here after work for drinks and their amazing bread and butter. 
I highly recommend get the risotto if they have it in season
author: Miguel E.

description:
Came here for dinner with a group of friends one Saturday night and our experience was very mixed.  The appetizers (meatballs, crostini and Brussel sprouts) were really underwhelming.  The pizza was quite good but a bit on the salty side. The main dish (Alaskan Cod) was solid.  Food-wise, it was a 3 star experience.  

Service was good and very quick and the restaurant itself (location and space) was really beautiful.  It was also on the pricey side.  Service was enough to bring the overall rating to 3.5 stars.  Probably won't recommend this restaurant since there are better Italian options in the city at the same price range.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Credo is a winner for me because the food is delicious, it's accessible, and it manages to lack pretense despite being in the Financial District.

I've tried a couple appetizers and sampled a few different pastas via sharing a lot family style, and I enjoyed everything! My favorites were the orichiette pasta with sausage and the brussel sprouts, which was both well seasoned and portioned.

Somehow the prices here are decent for downtown San Francisco, which was a major plus for me! The staff was also very kind and accommodating of our somewhat larger party, which is always appreciated. 

Finally, the decor was really interesting. In the bathrooms and across the dining rooms, there are news articles and powerful quotes displayed across the walls. It's all in all a very modern vibe.

I recommend this place to everyone across the Yelposphere! Enjoy and salute!
author: Stephen D.

description: Took my parents here when they were visiting from out of town. They live in a landlocked city so they were craving some fresh seafood. A somewhat limited menu but the crudo was incredible. Some of the other random small plates we got were very good as well.
author: Alex L.

description: Part of a private party today. Had 3 course meal. First was a salad. Very flavorful! Second was my salmon. Didn't like the stuff under it but the salmon was sooo perfect. Last was the red velvet cake. Super sweet and rich. Not the biggest fan of something that sweet but if you are, you'd be all about it!
author: Rose F.

description:
I had dinner at Credo in the FiDi a few nights ago and it was a fabulous experience. I'll mention that Yelp reviews led me here after a long day of traveling, which is always incredibly helpful.

It was Saturday night, and I realized that it might not be easy to get in just anywhere. I found an opening for a reservation at Credo and nabbed it. The service (as promised in other reviews) was superb. I had the halibut, which was amazing, and my kids enjoyed the filet, which was also nice. I have a teenager who travels the world sampling caesar salads in every venue possible, and she declared the caesar at Credo the best she'd experienced thus far. On that front, I wholeheartedly agreed. 

If you're looking for a fantastic meal, a great, laid back vibe, and wonderful service, Credo is where you'll find it.
author: Shelly K.

description:
I finally got to check out the sedanini here-- it was one of those days where I actually didn't do too much scoping out of the menu ahead of time! Verdict: Yes it's interesting, and pretty tasty, but I'm not sure about $25 tasty. Then again, my go to pasta spot in FiDi is Barbacco, the lower priced cousin of its neighbor Perbacco.

The sedanini surely looked impressive as they brought it to the table. It's basically a bowl of tomato basil pasta, covered in pizza dough. They make a show of break the pizza top, cutting it open, and folding it in half, so that the steam from your pasta rises up. 

Flavor-wise, good taste, though as always, I wish the basil was a bit more pronounced. The cheese was really gooey (read: hard to eat while having a convo) but tasty, the ground meat bits were tender and slightly chewy, with good flavor. The pizza cover was not flavored at all, which was disappointing.

Atmosphere was nice and decently quiet for a restaurant of its size. While it's not a spot you could do every day, it would be great for a slightly nicer night out. 3.4/5.
author: Nicole H.

description:
Cute little place in Fidi - good for dates and groups. The decor in here is awesome! High ceilings are kewllll 

Came here for dinner with some gals and ordered the octopus as my main. They warned it was more of an appetizer, but it was surprisingly filling! They did not skimp on the octopus and it was grilled very nicely and paired well with the snap peas and potatoes and the sauce. Funny thing was that the description didn't mention anything about flowers but the octopus was showered in all these flower petals, which we learned, were edible, and came from a peach farm that they get some of their other ingredients from. 

Our waiter who served our food was super nice and asked if we were allergic to any flowers - we told him guess we'll find out since we don't usually eat flowers LOL 

We declined dessert but still were served samplers of different types - such a nice surprise. Of course, they were sprinkled with flowers. 

Definitely make reservations, it was packed for dinner on a Wednesday night.
author: Vickie Z.

description:
Undercover Italian casual style wine setting tucked in the FiDi!  It can easily be missed while walking by this dim place!  The see through windows aren't open enough to see this lovely restaurant.  

Their Burrata marinated cherry tomatoes, toasted Levain was a great starter.

I went wowzers on their Ricotta Gnocchi with Truffle in a creamy sauce! The colorful presentation, flavor and texture was all there! 

Their Squash Blossom Pizza with truffle oil was different and a good take on using squash blossom.

The Sedanini was a baked pizza crust topping and inside was fresh penne, sausage bits with tomato sauce. It was entertaining on cutting it open.

They have ample entrees to order as well as refined cocktail drinks!

Excellent service and Timothy made me a virgin drink that I requested to be like a detox drink!  It was refreshing!  Basil, lemonade with a pinch of cayenne kick!  Lovely! 

I didn't care too much on the trout with citrus flavor and arugula mixed up with the dish. 

To end on a sweet tone, petite desserts were provided.  I like the fudge brownie-like one. 

Kudos to Credo!  I had a pleasant time!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I was super lucky to be invited by the Nob Hill Gazette, along with other Yelpers, to attend a dinner at Credo. I was a bit tired, having just arrived back in the US after a 30 hour journey from Africa but I was hungry and ready to eat!

After a quick introduction, the table ordered cocktails, which were all beautiful and tasty.

Then the food started coming out and it was magnificent. 

The Burrata, Marinated Cherry Tomatoes, Toasted Levain was one of my favorites. I do have a soft spot for burrata and this one was perfectly creamy.

The Crostini, Figs, Gorgonzola Dolce, Aged Balsamic also had some of my favorite flavor combinations. Did I ever mention my love for balsamic? That paired with fig is a match made in taste bud heaven.

If you're a tomato fan, Credo has an entire appetizer dedicated to honoring the beauty of heirloom tomatoes. It was pretty to the eye.

The entire table was excited by the Kauai Blue Prawns, Garlic, Butter, Parsley. The garlic butter had penetrated the large prawns.

The most visually pleasing dish was Octopus, Roasted Potatoes, Cherry Tomatoes, Shaved Fennel, Sugar Snap Peas, Romesco. The purples, pinks, greens, oranges, and whites were painted onto the plate. 

Squash Blossom Pizza, Creme Fraiche, Parmigiano, Truffle Oil, Chili Flakes - The crust was light and airy. The squash blossoms were reminiscent of the famous squash blossom dish at Mozza in LA.  

Another crowd pleaser was the Ricotta Gnocchi, Sweet Corn, Chanterelles, Truffle Brodo. I liked the sweetness of the corn and enjoyed the texture of the gnocchi.

We were getting so full by this point but the food just kept coming!

We were served the Risotto of the Day, which featured shrimp and morels. I'm a huge fan of risotto and this one was 4*.

He was in love with the Sedanini, Penne, Sweet Fennel Sausage, Tomato Sauce, Pizza Crust. I thought it had a cool presentation. It is basically a baked sausage penne topped with with a domed crust that is then cut into before serving.

Our final savory course was Mt. Lassen Trout, Shaved Root Vegetables, Citrus Vinaigrette. It was a light finish to a wonderful tasting of Credo's offerings.

We ended the meal with some artfully made dessert bites.

Credo had not been on my radar before being invited to this tasting meal but I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and variety of food. I would definitely recommend the spot for a solid Italian dinner. The prices are reasonable and everything we tried was good.
author: Yi Z.

description: Decent food, but service was sub-par.
author: Kimmy P.

description:
Had dinner here a couple nights ago and was greeted by the nicest people.  I definitely felt taken care of there.  Upon sitting down, we ordered drinks and were offered chips and small bread squares (focaccia?) that were super delicious.  The room is decorated with quotes from all around the world and from different times in history.  They are political, inspirational, controversial, and everything in between.  We were told that they wanted to start a conversation and create a discussion over great food at their restaurant. 

The food was amazing. We had this tomato and cucumber salad with varying species of each type of vegetable.  I usually am not a huge fan of salad, but this was was bursting with flavors. The dressing was light and tangy - perfect for the summer. 

We also had this shrimp dish with sauce that makes you want to drink every last drop.  You can use the bread they bring to the table to soak up every last bit.  That was one of my favorites.  We also had a pork, salmon and zucchini pappardelle dish.  The pork had a type of risotto bed underneath that was a dream with fried pork rinds that were delicious.  The salmon had a creamy sauce that I also loved. The zucchini pappardelle was good, but it didn't really stand out.  

The dessert was amazing.  We had a sorbet with a biscotti and then a panna cotta that blew my mind.  

Absolutely loved this place.  Extremely friendly with great food and cocktails thats also reasonably priced. How can you do better than that?? I've never been for lunch, but this seems like a great cute and trendy dinner spot that you could spend hours talking and eating. 

Service: 5/5
Food and drink: 5/5
Atmosphere: 5/5
Overall Experience: 5/5

P.S. Downstairs they also have private seating that you could probably reserve for a larger party.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Such an ideal place for power lunches. The hostess and bartender were friendly and attentive. I ordered the Ricotta Gnocchi which is a full vegetarian dish. I got it with a side of roasted chicken which was well cooked. I recommend this place to anyone that wants a creative meal that is both fast and not a wallet breaker!
author: Roberto G.

description:
I was luckily invited for this tasting event organized by Nob Hill Gazette. 

Overall it is a good experience, it represent high level of delicacy for Italian food. 

Must try is Sedanini penne. The sausage, penne and the cheese make a great combination. The pizza crust on the top taste fantastic as well, I never had this delicious pizza crust before. 

Second choice is the Riccotta Ginocchi, mushroom taste fresh and melt well with the corn. 

Third choice is the Kauai prawns. This dish tastes like Thai style and suddenly bring me back to Southeast Asia, the prawns are large and fresh. 

My suggestion for improvement is the Mt Lassen trout we had at the end, the trout was like frozen and lacks of freshness, the meat was kinda tight and not tender. Hope it can get better. 

Dinning environment is great. Also big thumb up for the service.
author: Kelvin Y.

description:
Cool and chic 'California Italian' spot downtown - if you are in the area, go here! The vibe is relaxed and authentic (especially for FiDi) and you'll be dreaming about the gnocchi - so good!! 

Our waiter  Gehno was lovely and informative. Everything he suggested from the burrata, to the squash blossom pizza and the halibut, to his wine suggestions were spot-on. Our party of 3 sitting at the bar felt extremely welcome and accommodated even though it was later and we were one of the last parties there.

Super rare gem in SF!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Came here for dinner last night.  Everyone was absolutely wonderful.  Jeremy was great! 

We got so many dishes!  The starter fresh tomato salad was pretty simple but had a great dressing.  

The shrimps were my favorite... I seriously wanted to just soak my bread in the sauce all night. 

The octopus salad was lovely too.  Almost had a Spanish flare.  The potatoes and the sauce were amazing. 

The pork was pretty good.  I felt it was a bit heavy for a summer entrée though.  It reminded me of fall or Christmas. 

The zucchini shaped like taglatelle was yummy.  I love zoodles so this dish was a special treat. 

The dessert was nice too. 

I've been here for lunch but dinner was so much better.  I'll definitely be back!
author: Kimberly L.

description:
I had lunch again yesterday. I loved the Yelp check in spiff of a glass of wine. They honored it but never  were aware of it. I got a Chardonnay for $18 value. I'll be back just for that alone. 

The pizza was fabulous.
author: Frank T.

description:
My first time at this hidden gem in FiDi.

The price of their wine by the glass was higher than i anticipated so i asked to see the menu of bottles. Seemed like a better deal to go with a bottle of red and it was easy to choose from their menu featured on a tablet. I'm no wine expert but i'm instantly impressed by any hints of a restaurant going digital. Efficient! And not impersonal at all. Our table was well attended to throughout the entire evening...

Kauai Blue Prawns had killer sauce. I wanted a bowl of this. I resisted any of the table bread until i realized i needed to mop all of that good stuff up. The Ricotta Gnocchi was just as pillowy as you'd expect. I wasn't huge on the morels but that didn't stop me from shoving the gnocchi down. The Octopus was tender and buttery soft. It was my favorite dish and if you don't know what to order, order this. The Salmon with quinoa sounded "too healthy" for me and i ended up pleasantly surprised - it was excellent. Nicely cooked piece of fish and flavor all there. Beef short rib was very good. Nice hearty plate.

There's always room for dessert. Two desserts in fact! I was sooo tempted by the Milk & Cookies but thought i'd be adventurous with their Strawberry Shortcake and Panna Cotta. Loved the cake and fresh strawberries. The Panna Cotta ended up being a bit too tart for me after the shortcake. The cherries and crumble were fantastic though.

I had my fill and waddled my way out completely content. 5 stars.
author: Samantha L.

description:
I dont do reviews so i am using my girlfriends account to leave one because this place deserves one. Great atmosphere, great service, great food. The sedanini is a must order. I ordered the sedanini and its a must. I will definitely be going back!

Kenny
author: Rea S.

description:
Had an amazing meal here! Service was excellent and food was superb. 

Came with a group of friends and was able to try a little bit of everything. 

-pork and ricotta meatballs w/ polenta
-melon, prosciutto, arugula
-burrata with cherry tomatoes
-kuaui blue prawns (ordered twice because it was so good)
-octopus
-zucchini pizza
-ricotta gnocchi

All were great but hands down the winner in my book was the prawns. 

The mixed drinks were also fantastic. Would definitely recommend and will be back to visit again soon!
author: Karen P.

description: One of my favorite business lunch spots downtown. Eclectic menu, great service, and consistently good food. It is just loud enough to not be boring but quiet enough to have a conversation. I have rented the room downstairs a few times for events and it works very well for medium size groups.
author: Jordan A.

description:
3 stars personal
4 stars w/friend/client

For your everyday meal, Credo isn't the best place to find a good value lunch, definitely on the pricy side. That being said the food is top notch and the atmosphere benefits those who have clients by giving plenty of open space and well plated meals.
author: Dion L.

description:
Got to give credit to credo - very comforting food for an affordable price! The servers and bar tenders are very kind and attentive and the food and drinks are not too heavy but filling! 

I ordered the steak while my friend had the short rib. I was very impressed with the short rib more than my steak, but the overall presentation and glaze on the short rib brought the meal to full circle! End the meal with their cheesecake (as simple as it sounds) - I could not stop eating their cheese cake! 

But lastly Credo has such a great atmosphere to it and is great for big parties. They have open bar deals and their staff is just super attentive. I drank a little more than I should have one time I was here and they were super nice and comforting about it unlike other restaurants that snub the drunkies!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
Rarely can I find Italian food that isn't excessively carb-heavy and nap-inducing, which is why I love Credo for its light dishes and fresh ingredients. I had the opportunity to try quite a few dishes, so here's a few of the most memorable ones from favorite to least:

-Gnocchi: Loved the cloud-like texture of the pasta. The variation I had featured tasty chanterelle mushrooms and sweet corn, and I enjoyed the fresh take on a dish that otherwise would've been too heavy.
-Sedanini: Had fun watching them cut open the dough cover to reveal the steaming pasta awaiting inside. The sauce was so fresh and tasted like it was made of tomatoes picked off the vine that very day. Bonus points for the unique fennel sausage.
-Octopus: I'm personally not a fan of octopus but have to admit they cooked it extremely well. Was pleasantly surprised by how soft and tender it was- none of the usual rubbery chewiness.
-Squash blossom pizza: I liked that the creme fraiche wasn't overpowering and instead allowed the natural flavors of the vegetables to shine through. And the truffle oil was an A+ addition.
-Heirloom tomatoes: Delicious and painless way to get your vegetables in with some of the freshest produce around.
-Kauai Blue Prawns, daily risotto, trout: Probably the most mediocre dishes. None were bad, but I thought they lacked a wow factor.
-Crostini: Beautiful in presentation but the amount of gorgonzola used was a bit tooo generous
-There was also this incredible burrata bruschetta with sweet pickled tomatoes that I can't find on the online menu but it was one of my favorite things of the night so definitely try asking for it!
author: Amy C.

description: Hands down this place has the best BLT in town.  The thick smoked applewood bacon is full of flavor and the tomatoes are just perfect. Herb aioli is used instead of regular lettuce really adds to the unique flavor. Sandwiched between fresh baked sour dough bread with house mayo (a bit too much mayo). Included is a hearty portion of potato salad. Overall, it's an expensive sandwich ($17), but one that you must try...if you like BLT's.
author: Robert K.

description: Credo is amazing if you're into contemporary Californian cuisine. Gehno was our waiter and he was charming and incredibly well informed and made some outstanding wine pairing suggestions. If you want your mouth to feel like it's on vacation this is the perfect spot. Love! Love! Love!
author: William F.

description: Great food in the fidi, a great environment, food is delicious and service is top notch.
author: Dan R.

description:
Came here on a Friday evening for dinner. Started with the Baked Pecorino (delicious!), tried their pumpkin gnocchi after that (the best!) and shared a chocolate hazelnut tart (nice closing note)

Recommend making a reservation!
author: S R.

description: I met two friends for dinner at Credo and we were not disappointed. There were so many delicious-sounding options on the menu we had a hard time deciding what to share. The squash blossom pizza was my favorite. Loved the staff, great atmosphere, all-around a winner. Will definitely be returning!
author: Bryn B.

description: Thought this place was casual and the food was so fresh and delicious.  Very high quality food in a casual fun atmosphere! We enjoyed a great friends dinner here.  I'm a vegetarian and I had to get the recipe for the summer fresh zucchini and roasted tomato dish I had here.
author: layla m.

description:
Credo is a nice, very casual, Italian lunch spot.

A friend of mine had just come back from Italy with a handful of wines he wanted us to try ( Lab rat style....heck I'm up for the task).

Four of us we're immediately seated. Our waiter was there pronto getting us water and opening bottles. I must at this point scream what a corkage deal they have at Credo....$10 a bottle (that's a deal son!).

For the appetizers we split the pork meatballs and the burrata cheese with tomatoes, evoo and warm bread. Both were outstanding!

For the mains two of us had the Lasagna and two had the rigatoni with Lamb ragu.....both were great. 

The Lasagna is served in a ceramic bowl and has layers of delicate pasta, cheese, and meat. All tender and flavorful.

The Lamb ragu was chocked full of meaty chunks of flavorful lamb, tomatoes, and spices. Lovely Al dente Rigatoni  a tiny bit over salted but no big deal.

Ambiance is pretty modern: open, airy, high ceilings, and very straight lined design.

Service was a tad get them in and out...but that wasnt a big deal.

Over all if you're looking for a great, simple quick meal Credo hits all the right buttons.
author: David G.

description:
I've been to Credo a few times and I have been blown away every time I've been here.  The service here was excellent and very attentive each time.  This time, I had the NY strip steak with a stuffed poblano and it may have been the best steak I've ever had.  

Definitely recommend this place!
author: Chelsey M.

description:
Absolutely delicious.  Laid back, very casual and lightning fast service.  Less than a minute walk from our hotel we came on a recco from the front desk @ The Omni.  

The crisp oysters w/ prosciutto, ricotta gnocchi and Dungeness crab sandwich were all phenomenal.
author: Robert L.

description: Picked this restaurant for its location near our hotel and the reviews and we were very pleased. We really liked the ambience, the quotes on the walls are a great conversation starter. Service was excellent and the food delicious.
author: Donna B.

description:
Valentines Day is a notoriously tricky one for many restaurants to get right--it really tests everyone when the house is busy and expectations are so high. My V-Day experience at Credo was absolutely wonderful, however. Everything from the food to the service to the atmosphere was lovely and I would be happy to go back (something that would be easy to do, given their well-rounded menu.)

We both ordered fish dishes (the salmon and the cod), and both were delicious and cooked expertly. The brussels sprouts appetizer was also a high point. As a bonus, we enjoyed a few Valentines touches that the staff provided, like a complimentary small glass of sparking wine and a small gift box of sweets.

Service often gets the short stick in Yelp reviews--well, in the good reviews anyway--so I'd like to give a shout-out to our waiter Tim and the rest of the staff. Thanks for providing a lovely evening!
author: Jason L.

description: I really enjoyed the quiet time I had initially . The hostess was sincere and polite . I will return
author: Jessica M.

description:
Coming from New York City, I can be a bit of a decor, food, and cocktail x wine snob, but Credo is definitely worth checking out whenever you're on the west coast up in San Francisco. It was a rainy day when i walked in, and the weather made me crave a nice bowl of soup. Delicious! They have fresh soups daily which complements nicely with a bowl of brussels sprouts which includes pancetta and apples - perfect complement of flavors. When in SF, you must have seafood so make sure to try the Saffron linguine with clams, excellent flavor. The octopus is always mouth watering. My girlfriend had the salmon which was perfectly cooked and i had the steak which was beautifully juicy. Make sure to grab a bottle of wine .. Credo's staff is extremely knowledgeable in viticulture and a pleasure to speak with - their conversation and vino recommendations complemented our meal perfectly. 

Insider tip: apparently they have an excellent happy hour which is great for the after work crowd, but make sure to get there early - friend tells me their pizzas and libations are fantastic, also another food x drink connoisseur. Decor is great, high ceilings with beautiful quotes along the wall. Will be back.
author: Chris R.

description:
Tried for six hours, six phone calls, multiple conversations to have a lunch delivered to a great client down the street from the restaurant.  Two separate people told me that it wouldn't be a problem.  Never had a promised phone call back from any "manager", so I kept calling them back.  At 6:15, the night before it was to be delivered, they told me sorry, we can't do it.  No lunch for my client and they left me hanging too late to fix it.  Obviously can't comment on the food, but certainly can comment on the service.  Miserable.

Follow-up:
This morning I received a call from their manager who was extremely apologetic and offered to help in any way possible.  They are sending lunch to our client today, and at no charge to us.  I am truly impressed with how Credo handled this and will definitely return.  My thanks to them for their kind response to our request.
author: Richard H.

description: Booking online or over the phone is impossible. I was calling for 3 days to book a private party event. While the hostess is unable to make such type of reservation she were referring me to the booking manager who did not return the calls. On a third day I finally learned that there is a different reservation at the same time. So the folks don't know how to look at the calendar either. Oh well, I lost a lot of time and now have to look for another venue.
author: Elena K.

description:
This was a work luncheon for six, and a great choice for us. Some eat meat, others do not. 

But it's so loud when busy that up stairs is unbearable. We prefer the downstairs room. 

I love the pumpkin gnocchi dish. Great vegetarian option for the neighborhood. Not a throw away try, it's rich with flavor and texture. 

The fried green tomatoes are a yummy starter. 

Go, but try to avoid peak hours if you want to hear your own thoughts. 

Helpful, friendly staff too. Gotta love that 92 Health Score, keep it up.
author: B K.

description: If you are looking for some light Italian food, and you are near downtown SF financial district. This is the place to go, didn't even reservation for small parties. Food was good.... Definitely try their pizza, the one with truffle oil, it's Heller good!!!!!!
author: Lex Z.

description:
Came here last Friday after work with some coworkers. The bar seating was full so we sat at a table. The staff was able to seat us right away and accommodate us just walking in. Our group of 5 all ordered different cocktails and the ones to note were the Guava Pimms Cup, the watermelon cocktail and the guys we were with loved the boulevardier. We ordered the shishito peppers, meatballs, burrata, and squash blossom pizza for the table. Honestly it was all SO good and wasnt even able to get any pictures before everyone started digging in. 

Service was knowledgeable and attentive without being overbearing or annoying. I think our server was named Sabrina and she was so sweet! 

Everything about this place is cool from the quotes on the wall to their custom looking tables. Will definitely come back here again but want to come back for lunch or dinner to try some entrees -- especially that sedandini!!
author: Elisabeth H.

description: Great service, food was okay, I would not consider it traditional Italian, great wine selection, desert menu was decent, GF pasta available, loud and noisy, causal dress.
author: Adriana A.

description:
Just ate at Credo for my first tie tonight. What can I say, an amazing meal with great service and environment.

I had the Padron Peppers, very spicy but incredible with the aoli.  I then had the burratta, you just can't go wrong. 

Then for the main course the prawns and the Mt. Lassen Trout. The prawns were so flavorful in the broth perfect for dipping bread in and cooked perfectly.

The trout was probably the best I have ever had.  Tender, juicy, savory, with a hint of a kick from the lemon pickled veggies.  Absolutely incredible. Very reasonably priced for the FiDi too.

Finally to top it all off a blackberry shortcake that was warm and moist. Just fantastic. 

I cannot say enough about how great this meal was. I will definitely be coming back even just for the great service and staff.
author: Kc K.

description:
An absolute gem of the FiDi, Credo is truly phenomenal!

Credo exudes quality and confidence, their dishes are articulated to be the center of attention.
Definitely consider this place next time you plan on dining out with a friend and be sure to save room for dessert!

Ambiance: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Food: 5/5
Overall Experience: 5/5

Thank you guys!
author: Sheila D.

description:
Currently writing this review on a full Credo stomach and could possibly slip into a food coma mid review. 

Ambience: Casual and trendy. I love the quotes that lined the walls of the restaurant. They're great conversation starters. 

Service: Excellent. We didn't have reservations and we came at peak dinner time, but thankfully they were able to accommodate us without a wait. Jeremy was very attentive and I'd randomly see him straighten chairs here and there which is minor, but shows he takes value in the restaurant. I like those little things. 

Food: Satisfying. 
- The prawns appetizer was so good, I'm still thinking about it. They come with their tails and heads on which can turn some people off, but I like that. All the sauce gets in the head too so that's a good sucking ;) We finished the shrimp and the waiter tried to take the dish away, but I stopped him because it's perfect dipping sauce for the bread. I could probably drink that sauce. There's no picture because I was too excited and jumped right in. 
- The crab fettuccine was really good. I love lemon flavors so this hit the spot. Can't go wrong with crab and lemon. 
- My boyfriend had the clam linguine. I think he's in a food coma because all I got out of him was, "It was good." It sure looked good though. 

Overall, my boyfriend and I had a great dinner to celebrate our anniversary. We'd definitely dine here again. Great food and atmosphere.
author: Rachel A.

description:
I had low expectations for this work lunch for a gals retirement.  There were 10 of us and they put us at a table in the alcove in the back at a large square table - which was nice because you  could really talk to everyone.

I had looked at the Yelp reviews and decided on the cavatelli with chicken meatballs. IT WAS VERY VERY tasty. The meatballs were very tender, and the pasta was cooked exactly al dente.  It was an expensive lunch but since the quality was very good for a group lunch,  I was very pleased.
author: Amy W.

description:
Credo is a really nice place to eat at. It's spacious for groups and the food is delicious. Came here twice before and the food was great. Service was a delight too. However, it made me wonder what took them almost 20 minutes to cut a cake...

They also give complimentary bread and butter if you ask. It's goood. My group tried the Roasted Octopus with Pepperonata, Crispy Potatoes, Radicchio & Fried Capers. I don't normally like octopus but this dish I liked. Their pizza appetizers are also good to try. Though it doesn't have any meat, the flavor makes up for it. For entree, I had the Garganelli with Chicken, Prosciutto, Sage Meatballs, Snap Peas & Parmesan Cream. The cream was yummy. It wasn't heavy but it was a little on the thick side. The meatballs were delicious. I think I got 6? For dessert, my favorite was the Vanilla Bean Gelato (I think I can't remember).

Definitely give Credo a try if you're feeling fancy and have a few bucks to spend.
author: Benita M.

description:
Came here for my friends birthday and was blown away by the decor.  It's classy and cute but with some great quotes that seemed to get funnier as we got to the second bottle of wine.  

The service was great and the food was fantastic.  As a self proclaimed foodie, I have to say that I will certainly be back.

Thanks for a fantastic night, Credo!
author: J M.

description: So, I had the Orecchiette with fennel sausage, Calabrian chili and broccoli rabe for lunch. It was very tasty and just the right amount. Definitely should be listed as three star expensive. We paid $41.00 a piece without ordering appetizers or drinks, other than my wife's watered down iced tea, which cost $5.00. Yes they did refill it but who cares when it's as weak as water? This place is tight and the waiters constantly rush past and knock into you. I would give the food four stars but overall with the prices, waiters in a rush and week tea... I give it a three star. We will be back for sure though. Maybe get seated with our backs to a wall - to avoid waiters knocking us around. All in all I recommend trying them.
author: Kirk M.

description:
my wife and i celebrated our anniversary dining at this restaurant and the FOOD IS SUPERB!!!
we had the kauai shrimp and arugula salad for starters.. then pork chop and halibut for our main.. HOW CAN THEY DESIGN SUCH A MARVELOUS DISH!!!  i highly recommend CREDO
author: Dale A.

description:
I have come here for business lunches a bunch of times, probably somewhere between 5-10 times, so I thought I'd let my fellow yelpers know how I rate this place.

I like the proximity of Credo to my office, so the FiDI location is primo. The ambiance is contemporary cool, with great quotes on the wall - even in the bathroom downstairs...

Service is attentive and professional. The waitstaff does a great job to appear and disappear when needed.

The food is good and properly priced for a nice place in FiDi in the San Francisco of the 2010s. Good wine list will cover what you need/crave for.

We started with the Octopus appetizer, and it was a good thing. Great starter, fresh crisply grilled octopus, fingerling potatoes for once not sliced lengthwise, but in nickle sized slices.

I had the shrimp, she had the seared ahi - see pics.  Very very good. Have returned and will continue to come back
author: Massimo M.

description: Solid food with great service. For apps, ordered the prawn appetizer, some sort of fondue, the green leek and broccoli soup (special), the butternut squash crostini, and the winter root vegetable salad. All were fantastic, although the salad  was quite underwhelming. For entrees, we had the octopus and the seafood pasta. While very tender, the octopus had the flavor and texture of being boiled. Not my favorite preparation and not recommended.The pasta had potential, but was way too salty. Our waiter, however, was very attentive and accommodating, making sure the salad and soup were prepared vegan. I'd eat here again, but would probably steer towards apps, rather than entrees.
author: Ami I.

description:
Had a quick get together lunch with a friend that worked down the street and she recommended this place.  As we all know, parking is horrible here!!!!  Even with street parking, it's all painted yellow!  I parked way up by Stockton Street.  

We sat at the bar because we didn't RSVP....for lunch!  So make note of that!  The bar was cool anyways.  

We ordered the mushroom pizza and the sweet potato gnocchi and shared.  

The gnocchi portion was average, not small or big, but if you have a big appetite or hungry, I suggest ordering a starter or something else.  The gnocchi had a good balance of savory and sweet and a little tartness to it, great combination and it's not heavy at all.  Our mushroom pizza was a little on the heavy side, so luckily we shared!  It wasn't too oily where you have to wipe it off, it was good.  Everything tasted fresh and wonderful, perfect place to meet up for lunch.
author: Lisa V.

description:
This was my third visit to the Credo in the past few years.  Every time I go I order the Sedanini.  Which is a great pasta dish, but what makes it amazing is that it comes with a crust on top.  The penne, sweet fennel sausage and tomato sauce are in the bowl.  Then what is essentially pizza crust is added on top of the bowl and I think baked.  The dish arrives and the waiter cuts into the crust and all the steam and delicious scent escapes the bowl.  I've never seen that dish on any other menu.  It's sooo good!  

Staff was friendly and very attentive.  I LOVED the music, it was a 2010s throwback.  Will definitely be going again and again.
author: Ray B.

description:
Credo has a very special place in my heart. 

My partner & I had our first date here and I was taken again to celebrate my birthday!

We showed up late, just as the restaurant was wrapping up for the night.

The Credo staff greeted us with such warmth. We were given a disclaimer that they were closing soon, but sat us down right away (& at the very same spot as our first date, which was purely meant to be). The host took our orders & my oh my...

Cocktails were divine.

Music was perfect.

Food was delicious & decadent. 

The fact that the kitchen fired up their ovens just for us was simply amazing. We did not feel rushed. The ambiance was wonderful & it was such a lovely experience.

I recommend Credo to locals, visitors, & anyone seeking an incredible meal & atmosphere.

Thank you Credo for making my birthday as special as you did!!! Can't wait to go back. XO.
author: Vanessa S.

description: Look for Brandy she's super amazing and helpful , was in a hurry to get small beauty stuff for my trip. I liked the Karri Balm!
author: Cj C.

description: This came highly recommended.  Service was nothing very special, we had reservations but were waiting for quite awhile.  Food was good but not the best in SF.
author: Chris S.

description:
Love the location of Credo! It is right in the middle of the Financial District so it is great for lunch meetings or a post work dinner!

I have come here for drinks, dinner and large group events that I have held both in the restaurant as well as the private room downstairs! It has it's own bar which is great to feel like a full event space.

The ambience is great and the service has always been spot on! Definitely worth a try for anyone who has not been!
author: Y L.

description:
COMPANY CHRISTMAS LUNCHEON

About a couple weeks ago I ate here for my company Christmas luncheon. I previewed the menu before I came here. One item that sounded interesting was the lemon fettuccine with dungeness crab, mint, and chili. I was interested in that item because I was planning to cook pasta with mint for Christmas dinner. When I got there the server stated the special was chippino, which is an Italian-American style stew. I stuck to my initial order with the lemon fettuccine with mint. I never had mint in pasta before. What made the dish stands out was the chili as it enhances the mint due its spiciness. Due to the combination of the mint and chili there was a hot-cool texture. The dungeness crab was okay but the mint and chili combination made the dish delicious. I ordered the apple strudel for dessert, which was okay. My rating was based on that lemon fettuccine with dungeness crab, mint, and chili. Overall lunch was okay, but I'm not going to complain as I didn't have to pay for lunch.
author: Gerald R.

description:
Had a wonderful dinner at Credo last night! I tried the risotto of the day, which was a delicious, fresh, and filling selection with tiger prawns.

To top it all off, Jeremy the host spoke to my friend and I about the quotes on the wall and their meaning and intention of provoking conversation. He even showed us the downstairs dining room which has even more awesome quotes and a great ambience.

For the food and the hosting, I'd give this place 10 stars if I could, and will definitely be coming back.
author: C. L.

description:
My coworker and I were at an event nearby and came by afterwards for dinner. It was Wednesday, December 9th at 6:30pm. We had reservations for later, around 7:45pm I think. They didn't have any open tables, so we opted to sit at the bar for dinner and drinks.

*Barrel aged manhattan (aged 6 weeks): bulliet bourbon, carpano antica, angostura ($11)
*Pimms cup: pimms n1, cucumber vodka, lemon & ginger ale ($11)

I enjoyed my manhattan. Dark and boozy with a smooth finish. My coworker liked how refreshing her pimms cup was.

*Roasted octopus with pepperonata, crispy potatoes, radicchio & fried capers ($12)
*Tagliatelle with homemade bolognese sauce & parmesan ($18)
*Potato gnocchi with braised duck, butternut squash, sage & pomegranate ($21)

Favorite dish was the octopus. The medley of tender octopus with crispy potatoes and peppers was delicious. We keep going back for more. The tagliatelle's sauce was so good! Nice and meaty. I was afraid I wouldn't like the pomegranate in the gnocchi, but it didn't add too much of a sweetness. I was in it more for the braised duck though.

We both had our meals with a glass of Cabernet sauvignon: veeder house, mount veeder 2009 ($16) each. Perfect as I love more full bodied reds.

Our server/bartender was great! He happily gave us suggestions in terms of entrees and glasses of wine. He took care of the bar well and had a great flow.

Very cute spot. Kind of had the feeling of a neighborhood restaurant in the middle of FiDi. I'd definitely cone back for that octopus! Yum!
author: Elena N.

description: We had an awesome experience as always so I though I would write a review. Great food. Very seasonal. The menu seems to change pretty often. Service was great. The desserts are a good size for sharing. The server was very knowledgeable about the wines we had too. I will definitely keep coming back.
author: Christopher A.

description:
I'm amazed that this place only has 3.5 stars. I visited for the first time last night and had a culinary experience that superceded my already high expectations. My crew and I started off with the amazing Baked Pecorino, which none of us had any idea what to expect but the waiter told us we couldn't miss out on this dish. Immediately after the first bite my friend shouted "We should probably get another one cuz this is damn good!" 10/10! We followed it up with the Octopus, Papardalle Pasta, and the Sedanini. The sedanini was extremely fun to eat and DELICIOUS. 

The vibe was really what put this restaurant over the top for me, it was extremely lively and energetic. The service staff did an amazing job and we really couldn't have asked for more.

Thank you Credo! You will be seeing a lot more of me. Make sure you have the Pecorino and Sedanini ready!
author: Nickon R.

description:
I came here in the evening for a work happy hour. They cleared away the tables, so there was just enough room for our large group to squeeze in. 

The bar only had one bartender working it, which was a bit of an issue, and we had the choice between beer and wine. I had the Sauvignon Blanc, which tasted fine. There were a variety small hors d'oeuvres, though not many for pescaterians/vegetarians. These included fried cheese balls, shrimp wrapped in prosciutto, pizza, avocado slices and meatballs. I enjoyed their avocado slices a lot, and the other food looked delicious but there was not much for me to eat. I was really impressed by the staff who were constantly taking away plates and providing more food. They did an amazing job. 

Overall, a fine place for a corporate happy hour.
author: Chelsea N.

description:
Credo does it all well. From the food to the ambience to the service - soak it all in and enjoy the fine dining experience. 

The cocktails are top notch and an added plus if you make it in for happy hour.

The pasta dishes stand out above all so do not hesitate to order more than 1 type.
author: Kiarash S.

description: Group of bromos came here for our Happy Birthday Jesus party. This place was great! Amazing and knowledgeable staff. The food was amazing. I had the daily risotto and it was perfect.
author: John S.

description:
Please sit at the bar on a lunch and give your business to Padraic.  He is committed to excellence and will take great care ifyou.  

4.5.18

Today Credo's staff passed the real stress test.  I walked in at 12:30PM and they were slammed while I was on a strict time clock today.  The very nice hostess gave us a table right away - a two top by the door. Our server Oscar and his expo partner Claudio were very responsive and attentive.  They inspired my 5-star update. My water got filled several times and the kitchen came through even though the entire restaurant was full.  Today I had to be demanding because I was on a time crunch.  We also modified the sausage/gypsy peppers Pizza and the kitchen performed to perfection. The steak salad was lights out and so was the pizza.  In the financial district, this will be our go to spot. Thanks Credo for coming through.
author: nino l.

description: Pasta was freshly made, light and appropriately sauced- not too much or too little. Meatball appetizer was good but not great. I'd recommend.
author: Steven R.

description:
I went to Credo for the first time today with some co-workers and had a wonderful lunch. We tried what felt like the entire menu and weren't disappointed by any of it! 

We ordered two gin cocktails, per the manager's recommendation, and both were outstanding! I had the watermelon cocktail and it was one of the best I have had (I learned later that they muddle the watermelon fresh, which definitely made a difference). We ordered the octopus and the burrata small plates for the table and there was nothing left when the servers came to take the plates away. The burrata was my personal favorite. 

I had the turkey burger for my main and it was crazy satisfying (and filling!). My co-workers had the gnocchi and the kale salad with ahi tuna, which they both raved about. My co-worker even said hours later that she "wasn't really a gnocchi person, but I totally want more!" I think that is review enough :)

To end the meal, we received their seasonal confections and their fig dessert. Again, there was nothing left on the plates! My personal favorite were the oatmeal crumble bars and the homemade marshmallows. We left completely stuffed. 

But what I think is arguably just as important, if not more so, was that the atmosphere and staff were truly amazing. The staff were very attentive and friendly, which made for an imensly enjoyable break away from the office. I can't wait to come back after work to try out their dinner menu; I am sure I will love it just as much!
author: Danielle F.

description:
244. Came here for a friend's birthday.  We ordered the goat cheese appetizer, which was pretty good-- a little tangy and sour mixed perfectly together.  I got the garganelli with sage meatballs, which wasn't filling, even for a small person like me.

+1 for large groups.  But that's about it.  Service was really really slow.  It took a long time just to take our order because no one bothered to stop by our table!  And when we wanted to leave, it took a long time just to get our bill.  Overall, the food was alright, but our party felt neglected for most of the night... and the place wasn't even packed.
author: Katherine C.

description: My favorite meet-friends-from-out-of-town-for-dinner-after-work place in the FiDi! Really warm and friendly service, yummy food and a great atmosphere for catching up (the quotes on the walls are always great conversation starters!) I always start with the heavenly burrata, move on to a pasta and share a dessert, but everything we order is fresh and delicious.
author: Kari G.

description:
I'm not usually a big gnocchi fan but their corn gnocchi dish was so good! I ordered it for lunch and at dinner time I was thinking man I want more gnocchi. 

I've been here a couple times and every dish I've ordered has been fantastic.
author: Robin C.

description: I loved Credo, very nice place! Absolutely amazing service and the food was excellent! I had one of the salads and it was very fresh and tasty! I would definitely recommend coming here. The bartender mark treated me and my friends so nicely, he was very attentive.
author: Emily G.

description:
*Review is for a private work event*  

I definitely liked the feel of Credo and think that it could be a nice date spot.  All the quotes on the walls are fun to read and keep you entertained.  Otherwise, I thought the place was just ok.  I had some champagne and tasted the appetizers.  The meatballs, and avocado slices were probably the most memorable.  The pizza was average.
author: Shannon L.

description: Wonderful ambiance, had quite a nice dinner with colleagues last night. Most of my friends ordered the cod which seemed really good. The steak I had was alright, it wasn't as tender and juicy as I like, but the salad and pasta were good!! Location was also convenient to get to by bart.
author: Michelle K.

description: Love the decor, but the food was very average. We had the butternut squash crudité (too sweet) and the pizza.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I'll start with some positives.  Not too expensive place to load up on carbs in the FiDi.  The upstairs dining room is open and airy.  And, they have a cool private dining room with a literary theme with bright white walls with cool quotes.

Onto the rest . . . their pastas are solid, but not as good as nearby Perbacco.  Their oven-baked pizzas are in my opinion the best in the FiDi.

The real problem is the service.  Unfortunately it's consistently slow and unsophisticated.  As an example, we recently dined with a large group of about 10 on a weeknight; and we didn't finish until 3 hours after our reservation.  The appetizer course was split.  She served the meatballs, then much later served the crostinis.  Entrees were very slow coming as well.

Aside from slow food service, our waitress was not the brightest bulb in the bunch.  I'm currently on a low carb diet due to gestational diabetes.  The special pizza of the night was said something like squash, creme fraiche, truffle oil.  I asked her if there was any cheese on the pizza.  She kept saying yes, "cream cheese" and parmesan.  And, I explained that creme fraiche is not cheese; and asked if there was any other cheese like mozzarella.  She went back to ask the kitchen, and came back and said yes there was parmesan and another cheese.  So, I ordered the special pizza.   But, when I got the pizza, there was only creme fraiche and parmesean, which doesn't have enough fat to balance out the carbs from the crust.  So frustrating.  It was too late to order something else, so of course, I ate the pizza, and my blood sugars went through the roof.  Thanks, incompetent waitress.
author: Christina L.

description:
I have been waiting to start my review to come up with the perfect wording for a perfect place.  

Came here with friends before the Hedwig play at the Golden Gate theater.  It's in the financial district so it wasn't crowded on a Saturday night.

Maybe I was just giddy from being with my friends, but this was the best meal I had in a long time.  The waitress was so good at helping me find something and said they could even make me something special.  But, lol, I think she was confused at some point of what a vegan can eat because she recommended fish and chicken dishes twice.  Laughed and corrected herself.  Too cute.

Drinks and food were so well prepared I want to fly back just to go here again.

I wish I could review our specific food but by the time the bill came, we were too "happy"...and the exact dishes have been long forgotten.
author: Sarena M.

description: Can't wait to go again! Great food, service, near my office. Triple threat! A little pricey but, the quality and service on spot on. Worth it! We shared fig and cheese crustini, delish. I had the spinach salad with hanger steak, also great. I asked for rare meat and it was tender. Enjoyed it all and really appreciated the excellent, speedy service!
author: Teresa B.

description:
Amazing hospitality. Felt like I was at home. Very cozy, authentic San Franciscan spot. Loved it!
The cocktails were perfectly made and the food was perfect to the palette. Not too sweet, not too simple. Just the perfect taste. Thank you!
author: Norma N.

description: We ate here on 6-29/18 with a group of 5. The food and service were excellent. We had baked pecorino as an appetizer and I highly recommend it. Plenty of gooey melted cheese with flavors of honey and hazelnut served with toasted bread points. Then more fresh bread that was delicious. One of our party had the sole and the waited deboned it tableside - fun to watch. And it was amazing. I had an interesting pasta with baked pizza crust - I thought that was a great twist on a red sauce pasta bowl.  We had a variety of tasty desserts. Everything about this place was recommendable.
author: Carol W.

description:
Wow... all I have to say is wow. This is a date spot, a bring your gals to on a Friday night spot. The ambiance is truly sensual and hip and prime for a tinder date. 

Must gets:
Burrata - do yourself a favor and order upon arrival. The cheese is buttery and luxury and wraps you up in its warm embrace. Comes with bread. 
Meatballs- holy hell, may be the best meatballs in SF. Good to share on a tinder date. 
Risotto - buttery, sensual, seafood. Please indulge. 
Pizza - the mushroom pizza is unbelievable. Has a powdery crust and earthy after bite. 
-all of the pastas. Yep, I've ordered all of them. I am overweight by nature and couldn't resist ordering the fettuccine, linguine, orecchiette. We ordered every dish and each one was a medley of flavors, engulfing my spirit and soul. 


The bread - honestly I could come here just for the bread. It arrives to your table on a pizza sheet joined with a ramekin of salted butter. If you're on a diet. Don't come here 

Dessert: the tiramisu, must order. 

Best first date spot in SF 

Shouts outs: Tim; best service I've ever had legally. Attractive and enjoyable. Knew his stuff 

Brandon: the GM, extremely generous and knowledgeable. Cares about every foodie.
author: Sally N.

description: Officially one of my favorite spots now. I never heard of this place until today, Marc the bartender definitely deserves a raise! He took care of me and my friends very well. Come here to have a good time with friends, don't rush your time here! You'll love it!!
author: Stephanie B.

description: Food was bland, cold and just not very good. First course was scallop crudo and it had a bizarre flavor and there was this white sauce on it that I could have sworn was miracle whip. Second course was octopus and the octopus itself was nice and tender but the all the stuff that came with it was just a muddled mess. Main course was cavatelli with chicken. It was under seasoned, the pesto was watery, and the chicken was over cooked. The plate was also a sloppy mess. Desert was good, chocolate hazelnut tart. Espresso was served without sugar. If you have to ask for it, by the time you get it your espresso is cold. Service was good but slow.
author: Carl D.

description: Been wanting to try this place for awhile now and finally got the chance to. The restaurant was pretty packed when we got there. Good thing we made reservations! Started off with the octopus salad, which was really good. For our mains, we got linguine & clams (delicious!), the NY steak (cooked to perfection!), their risotto of the day (probably my favorite). We also tried the Sedanini penne which was pasta cooked inside a pizza crust (interesting). Their Kauai prawns were delicious too. We were Stuffed but still wanted to try a couple of their desserts (pretty sweet). Overall, the food was amazing and the service was awesome. I would highly recommend this place and I'm definitely coming back soon!
author: Stanley L.

description:
The hardest thing in working around the Financial District is deciding on a lunch spot that fits your needs.  Located in a former bank space, the feel is very interesting with its high ceilings and large front window.  Seated at a table just about at the center of the restaurant, we were able to carry our conversations without any noise issues.  Only one of our party of three had dined here before so we trusted his recommendation in ordering a pizza.  
With my lunch guests being calorie conscious, we shared the roasted octopus and sausage pizza as appetizers and ordered individual entrees; in my guests' cases, they ordered salads for their main meals.  The octopus was tasty and interestingly served on a bed of warm potatoes and greens; the octopus slices were tender but not mushy.  The pizza was still hot and the sausage had a good mix of herb flavors.
Studying their pasta list, the one that drew me the most was the baked lasagna with chicken (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=b33jyJVrzFPKSQrplGGwAQ&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q).  When my bowl arrived, my two guests were surprised at the portions, commenting that it looked modest; actually, it was just right, as most pasta lovers know, lasagna is filling due to the richness of the cheeses and layers of pasta.  The flavors were good and the chicken was nicely done, not overly dry.  The bread slice was the perfect ending in sopping up the last of the sauce.
Service was good as empty plates were replaced and water and iced tea glasses refilled.  The only flub was my iced tea glass.  Not looking at it carefully, I thought it was an artistic glass with some molding on it.  One guest said, "Hey Mike, your glass is cracked!"  After a closer look, we confirmed this and luckily it wasn't to the point of leaking so no harm, no foul.
We were in and out of the restaurant in just a little over an hour.  All of the tables in our immediate area were occupied so I recommend making reservations here.
Will stop in again to try other pastas dishes.
author: Mike C.

description:
Great for events, friendly staff and good food.

Have been to several events at this location, and am impressed by the staff, service and how well-suited it is for relatively small gatherings.  The location downtown is also great, convenient to access.
author: Alexander G.

description:
WOW! We just had a small, 6 ppl, company lunch in the downstairs room. Thank goodness because upstairs was way too loud. 

I had Pumpkin Gnocchi served with brussels sprouts, celery root, apples, pomegranate, sage brown butter. So delicious!  

We all can't wait to go back. 

The only thing that was a problem was that there was a large 20 something party that took up most of our lovely servers time.  We waited so long that we skipped dessert.  Next time for sure. 

Try them for lunch and ask for downstairs, quieter and more private space.  

YUMMY!
author: Allison W.

description:
Credo feels like my best kept secret that I also want to tell all my friends about. It's alluring and unassuming, romantic and relaxing, with stellar service to boot. 

Good food in San Francisco is a given these days. With so much competition, I've come to expect a good meal anywhere. Credo's fare far surpassed my expectations with their fresh seafood and delicious drinks. But what really set my experience apart was the exceptional service and the inviting atmosphere. 

This place has the personality that many modern establishments lack, so you'll go for the food and return for the new restaurant friend you've made. (And then thank me for spilling my big secret).
author: Jen L.

description: Went here for dinner and got the gnocchi and some bread with burrata. It's a cute place and the food is fantastic!
author: Sam H.

description:
Had a wonderful lunch last week, Brandon was a helpful person in giving us amazing choices from the menu for our group celebration! 

Thank you! 
M.
author: Marcos S.

description: Dinner at Credo was amazing!! If you are looking for a casual yet authentic Italian restaurant in the city - Credo is your best bet!!  We started with the garlic butter Kauai blue prawns that's so yummy. You can't miss the Octopus with roasted potatoes, shaved fennel topped with an herb aioli. Octopus just feels that it melts in your mouth.  For our main course, we had lemon fettuccine with crab and the sedanini. Both pasta dishes were very delectable in its own right. I like that the sedanini is a pasta dish that's covered with a pizza dough. Pretty interesting presentation. For desserts - one should not miss out the tiramisu and the apple crisp with vanilla gelato! Will definitely recommend others to dine here!
author: Arlene M.

description: Came here with a few friends for dinner and drinks. Great food (I definitely recommend the Pappardelle), great drinks, and a nice vibe.
author: Ashton L.

description: I had a business lunch today and this place was fantastic.  The food and service was outstanding. I ordered the meatball appetizer with the salmon main course.
author: Rob C.

description: Extremely impressed with the totality of this place! My girlfriend and I loved the Blue Prawns! We will definitely come back for more and soon Credo will be one of our top 3 favorite places in San Francisco. More power to the whole Credo team!
author: Harold J.

description:
Great wine list & appetizers at the bar. Melted pecorino dish, sauteed prawns- delicious. 
The GM was very knowledgeable in wine pairing & nailed it on his suggestions.
Can't wait to go back for dinner soon.
author: Tambo T.

description: Wonderful casual modern Italian. I can't believe I missed trying Credo till now. Great food, ambiance and service.
author: David T.
