description: We came here on a whim after a horrible day in San Fran and randomly bumped into the owner, Clint Reilly. He asked us about our day and we explained what a unpleasant afternoon we had. Mr. Reilly was so kind and sent us in without hesitation and made sure we were seated quickly and taken care of. The staff were kind and quick to help. The food was so delicious. The people who work there are attentive  and friendly. It completely made our day and was a major highlight of our trip. I would absolutely recommend this restaurant to anyone in the area.
author: Levar O.

description:
Had lunch here 3/29/17. Food was so mediocre  - especially for the price. My turkey burger was overcooked and super salty. Also, I asked for lettuce instead of a burger bun (yes I'm one of those) and my burger came on a tiny bed of wilted shredded lettuce. Looked like something they serve at soup kitchens. I was so dissappointed, I was going to complain but since the burger didn't even taste good - quality crispy lettuce couldn't save it anyway so why bother. My friend's dish looks bland too - looked like store bought pasta + bland sauce for over $20. 

I'll never come back here.
author: Phantom Of Yel P.

description: Had our 3rd holiday part in a year here but I think it will be our last. Unfortunately our server was not in a mood to be at work (rote fake servile thing doesn't do it for me, esp when paired with badly timed interruptions) and that brought down our celebration some. Drinks and appetizers were good but I was disappointed in my entree (esp given the price, fish was not med rare and a tad over salted) and thought the broccolini side was too bitter to be edible.  Vegetarian be advised there is minimal selection...
author: Ah T.

description: Delicious halibut, chicken and pasta. Great bread and butter. Not a huge fan of the octopus or meatballs, but there's plenty to choose from. Skip the $5 iced tea because it tastes like water. Service is good although it's cramped so they bump into you a lot. Expect to pay $30-$40 per person for lunch. Yelp needs to update them to at least $$$
author: Nancy R.

description:
Anytime one of my gfs suggests a leisurely lunch in the Fidi, I happily accept. It's a chance to slow down and take a breather.  

First off, who doesn't like an interesting ambiance? the boldly written quotes on the wall stand out right off the bat. From Mahatma Gandhi to Mike Tyson, these creeds start with two powerful words "I believe ..."

After appreciating the open kitchen and the Fidi clientele around us, we put in our orders: pork & ricotta meatballs with parmigianno polenta, butternut squash soup, coriander crusted ahi tuna on top of kale and cara cara oranges and pan roasted sea scallops on black risotto.  Wholly satisfying, enjoyable, pleasing. Service was of no fault. 

I believe I'll be back.
author: Janice C.

description:
Every aspect of our meal at Credo was phenomenal! From the pre-dinner Manhattan / Martini at the bar, to the appetizers, to the delicious Sangiovese wine (thanks to the great recommendation from our waiter based on what we were planning to order as main courses), to the main courses themselves, it was an all-around great experience! Our service was very good as well. 

Starters: 
Green & French White Asparagus: Huge asparagus w/ tasty Gribiche Sauce - would order again. 
Kauai Blue Prawns: HUGE prawns, nice taste, might try a different dish next time but definitely worth trying once! 

Mains: 
Sedanini, Penne, Sweet Fennel Sausage, Tomato Sauce, Pizza Crust: THIS IS A MUST TRY. It's pasta inside a pizza crust (the crust has a buttery garlic flavor that was to die for). Don't go to Credo and not order this. 
Braised Beef Short Rib, Polenta, Roasted Vegetables, Red Wine Sauce: Beautiful short rib tower with short ribs that melted in your mouth. The polenta was a perfect base for this dish. 

I'll be back!!
author: Marshall J.

description:
Credo is definitely our favorite Italian spot in SF. All around great service, ambiance, and food, that makes for a wonderful experience.

For starters, the service was impeccable. We came at prime dinner time (w/o a reservation too) and they made a special effort to take care of my girlfriend and me. Management was very attentive and charming and the rest of the staff was so kind and helpful. When I left to use the restroom, someone had folded my napkin and placed it on my chair. When we were running out of room on the table for the rest of our food, the management came and slid another table next to ours so we wouldn't feel crowded. I have never experienced anything like that. They definitely take pride in making sure their patrons feel welcome and comfortable.

The ambiance is casual but classy, a perfect spot for drinks after work or a fun but upscale date spot. They have hundreds of quotes on the walls that range from inspiring (Anne Frank about the human spirit) to funny (Stephen Colbert about bears). 

The food is delicious, too. We've had everything from the pizza and kale salad, to shrimp and clams and always come away full and satisfied. The cocktails are also delicious and they serve one helluva old fashioned. 

All in all, Credo is a 5 star establishment that I would recommend to anyone. They really care about their patrons and it shows in all aspects of the Credo experience.
author: Jon C.

description: This little undiscovered gem will leave you wanting more! Amazingly friendly service with the most delicious food to back it up. Don't miss the squash blossom pizza... it's amazing!!!! I'll be back!
author: Anita S.

description: Service was quick and efficient, the host was super kind and sweet. The food is fantastic, great menu! The cherry tomatoes that come with the burrata are beautiful, they're not raw, and rather cooked a little bit and are absolutely amazing - as is the burrata. The ricotta gnocchi with corn and chanterelles was delicious as well. Can't complain!
author: Andrea L.

description: The Ricotta Gnocchi, Sweet Corn, Chanterelles, Truffle Brodo is really extraordinary in flavor and texture.  Can't wait to go back just for this!  They also gave us a generous portion of bread before our meal, served on an attractive wooden chopping board with plenty of butter.
author: Deborah C.

description:
Pros:  fairly attentive service, good atmosphere, various clientele basis
      
Cons:  E_X_P_E_N_S_I_V_E!  One pizza margeurita and a club sandwich costs $73.35!

Will probably come to this establishment again, but the price = Holy Molee!
author: Jesse F.

description:
Came here with my company for dinner and wasn't impressed by the food...

* Sauvignon Blanc - was delicious! super light and refreshing white wine!
* Pork & Ricotta Meatballs - No bueno. The meatballs weren't flavorful and it wasn't anything special
* Rigatoni w/ Spicy Lamb Ragu - Sounded good but it was the biggest disappointment... the lamb was ragu was super salty!! I couldn't even eat the lamb :/
* Tiramisu - Little to no rum taste and lots of cream. However, i did like the chocolate shavings on top.

Two stars instead of one because I did like one of the appetizers.... it was a bruschetta with apple, brie?, and prosciutto. Also, the wine was pretty great! But I definitely will not be returning.
author: Leilani Y.

description:
Great spot for a business lunch, with a nice twist on Italian dining.  The menu has more of the mediterrean italian dishes rather than the carb heavy ones.

That being said, my dining companions & I went with the carb heavier options.  The lamb burger panini was pretty good.  Tender and not gamey at all, just way the lamb should be cooked.

The parmesean garlic fries hit the spot as well a they a pretty extensive wine selection as well.
author: Matt P.

description: Brandon and his staff were phenomenal. Every course was delicious and service was top notch!
author: Lev W.

description:
Credo offers excellent dishes and service! The Ricotta Gnocchi, Morels, Asparagus, Green Garlic suddenly became my instant favorite. Our group got all sorts of dessert and the Marscapone Cheesecake, Huckleberry Sauce, Ginger-Graham Crackers is really delicious.

Be sure to talk to Brandon, Jeremy, and/or Tim. They know the menu well and give the best recommendations!

I'll definitely go back again for more.
author: Jake T.

description: One of the best dining experiences i have had. Tried almost every appetizer and 3 main dishes. All so amazing! Gnocchi and Risotto were my fave. Wine selections were also too notch. Service was outstanding.
author: Megan C.

description: My first time in and absolutely exceeded my expectations! Came in for lunch with my coworker and got the BLT. It was delicious! Will definitely be coming back to try something else. Would recommend this to anyone who wants to get out of the office for a good meal or even for a date!  Thank you Credo!
author: Brittany B.

description:
Super Yummm! Had a Romantic date with my Man last night. Our meals were so tasty. We had porkChops, NySteak and potatoes finished with banana pudding. We are still talking about it this morning. Thank you to Mark for his topQuality service. Enjoyed reading quotes in between staring at my handsomeMan and eating my food.
The Manhattan Bourbon was perfect match for my dinner.
author: Jenell F.

description: Reservations are available. The ambiance is light and open. The food is pretty good. The octopus is one of their best dishes. A bit hipster in vibe.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Came here with a former co-worker to catch up. I understand it was lunch time, but it was so difficult to flag someone to take our order and such after we were seated by the host. 

When our waiter took our order, he wasn't the friendliest, and was trying to rush us. 

We order the appetizer to start, and boy it was so salty and over seasoned that powered over the octopus. Since it was so busy (too hard to find the waiter and get his attention), and we were hungry we just ate it. 

We order pasta dishes for our main lunch, the tagliatelle and the fettuccine with spinach and salmon. They worth a disappointment. They didn't taste fresh, uneventful and salty again. Again, we ate them because it was just too hard to flad down the waiter, and the food too way longer than it should to come.

So there you have it. That sums up our experience at Credo. We were immensely looking forward to dining here as big foodies. So there was such a disspointment. Especially since it has been a longer running restaurant establishment in the FiDi district. But then again, that is probably why it has been long running in the FiDi; since people are always coming and going in the area, they don't know better, perhaps they just go in and probably get one meal and never come back. Or perhaps "desperate" for a quick lunch near their office, they will just accept the subpar.
author: Sonia A.

description: I absolutely love this restaurant!! Every time we come to town this is always our first stop. They provide great service and the food and drinks are excellent!! I love the quotes and I will always choose Jason Erickson to handle every event!!
author: Elka G.

description: We were in SF in 2012 and ran across Credo. We thought it was amazing. We had a group trip in July 2017 and suggested Credo. So glad we did. Everyone thought the food was remarkably delicious. Service was great. Wine list well curated and fairly priced.
author: Anne F.

description: This place is a hidden gem. There are 10s of quotes all over the walls which are both witty and inspiring. The food tasted great and the service was incredible! Would definitely go back when I visit SF again!
author: Ramsey E.

description: We wanted a tasty Italian spot close to the FiDi. This spot worked geographically and much to our delight it worked for our tastebuds too! We went Italian with our wines, the Barolo (red) and the Arneis (white). We started with the crostini. The figs and baslamic were an awesome combination with the cheese. My husband got the steak that came with a lovely grilled stuffed pepper. I had the linguini with clams in a spicy butter sauce that was to die for. We ended it all with some sorbet. Felt the ambiance, service and cost were all on point as well.
author: Carmen S.

description:
I have experience with Credo both as a restaurant patron and as a host for a corporate event I held there. I really dig this place. I love the whole vibe - the walls are covered in inspirational quotes, but not cheesy ones. You feel good just reading the walls. The corporate event I held there was a fundraising mixer we did in The Archive, a room downstairs that is secluded from the hustle and bustle of the restaurant. It feels very private. The food and wine pairings were superb. The little noshes were great for grazing, and they were just heavy enough to make sure that the wine didn't get ahead of you. I remember the pizza being rather great. And...they gave us to-go boxes to take what the crowd left. Yum.

My dinner experience was great as well. I had tastes of several appetizers: the burrata, the meatballs, and the polenta. The burrata was strange and amazing. The texture was so silky, and the hit of sea salt really set it off. The polenta used really meaty mushrooms, which gave it depth. I thought it was interesting to serve polenta *on* toast, but hey, it tasted great.

I had the mushroom risotto, which used those same meaty mushrooms that were in the polenta. It was delectable. Every person in our party completely cleaned their plates. My observation of our other entrees looked great as well. I liked how this restaurant does Italian without being 75% pasta.

And one last little thing: this was the only restaurant in the FiDi within reasonable walking distance that could seat a table of eight at 5pm with more than a week's notice. I didn't think it would be that tough, but it was. Credo will definitely join my short list of preferred restaurants in the area.
author: Kelsey S.

description: Love Credo.  The food, the atmosphere, the service.  I particularly love the appetizers and could make an entire meal out of them.  Great deal on corkage as well.
author: Greta R.

description: So glad we gave it a second chance. We love the room! So inspiring and fun to read the walls. A great first date place to encourage conversation from some of the quotes! Padraig (sorry if I spelled wrong) was our server, and he was quiet and thoughtful, and very helpful! He made my birthday dinner one to remember! (The bread is still delicious.) We'll definitely be back.
author: Robin A.

description:
Drooooool.

Maybe it's because I was having a miserable week when I went here, but this place had the best pasta and best burrata I'd had in ages. I just wanna eat it forever.

The one weird moment was when I took my mom there, and we happened to be eating while a large corporate group was arriving. But the staff handled it very well!
author: Jessica K.

description: Credo catered our office lunch and the food was truly exceptional! Everyone at the office was raving about it (and continues to do so). Highly recommend these guys.
author: Marcel C.

description: Best restaurant in the city, hands down! The hostess was professional and friendly. The servers are experts at their craft, especially Erika who served us. The food... phenomenal. I ordered the ricotta gnocchi w/chicken and every bite was orgasmic. I don't know what type of secret magic sprinkles they use in the kitchen, but it keeps bringing me back. Even the music is perfectly selected; someone has great taste. Their attention to detail is so specific, the decor on the wall and the lighting gives SF MOMA a run for its money. I would give them an extra star if I could.
author: Mo S.

description: I usually eat in the Marina, but Amazing experience! We had the  gnocchi, the arugula salad and panna cotta among the rest of the food my party ordered. Perfect wine and plenty of love from the staff. They all made us feel special especially Kelly and Jeremy the manager who talked to us. My sister 22nd was perfect ! ThAnk you Credo for a new gem in the FiDi .
author: Daniela M.

description: This place is bomb!! From the service to the drinks to the AMAZING food, I would HIGHLY recommend this. I work downtown so the location is excellent and this will most definitely be my new "go to" place! I would recommend the pizza, halibut, chop salad, and risotto. Super dank! Must try!
author: Sara G.

description: This place is great in every sense of the word, great food, great service and great people. I came in for drinks and dinner with my two girlfriends on a Tuesday night. I highly recommend the guava pimm's cup cocktail. I also had the sedanini pasta bowl that has a pizza crust on top and it was delicious. I definitely recommend this place for anyone who wants to have some of the best food in San Francisco.
author: Yaritza B.

description: Food was delicious. Ambience was very nice. The squash pizza was really good, and the cucumber/avocado was presented very nicely and was tasty. We came on a Friday night and it wasn't very full, but we found it hard to get the waiters' attention.
author: Nitesh D.

description: New favorite Italian place such cute decorating as well. To start they have fresh bread they bring to the table so good. We got the burrata with tomatoes highly recommend as well as the artichoke hearts. My entree was the gnocchi and it was amazing just the right amount of truffle oil. Great dining experience can be a little pricey but so worth it
author: Jessica G.

description: This is one of my favorite places in the city. Great food and impeccable service. Whether for a business lunch or dinner with friends, this is a go to in my rotation. Extra points for their wine selection and changing menu. Brandon the manager takes especially good care to make sure you have the best experience possible. Will be back!
author: Brandon R.

description: Impeccable service! I went for lunch with work mates and I loved it! The decor is very interesting I loved the quotes everywhere. We are downstairs away from the hustle and bustle and it was marvelous!! We began with octopus, raclette of cheese with filberts, and meatballs in polenta...everything was delicious, fresh and bursting with flavor!! The bread was a rustic whole grain and I broke my no bread rule to try it!! For my entree I selected the Pumpkin Gnocchi with Brussels sprouts and pomegranate seeds with browned butter and sage leaves..it was heavenly on a rainy day! So comforting. For dessert we ordered a little bit of everything..carrot cheesecake, sorbets, chocolate cake..I loved it! But most of all I loved the attention to detail, the impeccable service and the feeling of ease. I work here so having lunch is something that I've done all over..Credo is a cut above your standard lunch in the Fi-Di. It was a total overall five star experience. It's elevated to one of my favs I love it!!
author: Mina B.

description:
Girls night out last Thursday and I picked Credo... food was amazingly delicious! Shrimp dish was the best I have tasted in SF! We also had the ricotta gnocchi, octopus , risotto and the petrale sole! so so good!

Cocktails are good too. Service is great and most of all laid back unpretentious place.
author: Carrie F.

description:
Disappointing. Really disappointing. We came here for my work Christmas lunch. Eight ladies. We booked ahead, confirmed and they had our table ready when we arrived. 

The menu looked good - I was hopeful! We ordered our drinks, and 25 minutes later our lemonade's finally arrived. They were delicious, and it was busy so didn't say anything. We all ordered and by the time the food came we were all starving. 

I can only describe my entree as a small appetiser. It was delicious but for $27 dollars I was expecting more than four scallops and 17 grains of rice. When I mentioned to the waiter that it was a little on the small side and did it comes with a side he shook his head and wandered off. 

My colleagues ordered the pork, risotto, shrimp pasta and sea bass and each of them said the same things - tasty but where's the rest of it? 

This place is not cheap, and being english I'm not one to hanker after huge american sized portions, but having mentioned to the waiter a second time that wefound the meal small and was still hungry I honestly expected more of a response than 'ok'.

I love try new places, and always try to look for something nice to say about everywhere I go, but credo, you ruined Christmas lunch for our whole team, which was a shame because the tiny bit of food you did give us was actually really nice...
author: Jemma B.

description: Unusual to find a restaurant where the wallpaper is noteworthy - but the walls are filled with interesting quotes.  The food is good. Some of our party loved it, some thought it was good but not remarkable. Overall worth a visit.
author: Jonathan B.

description: Credo catered lunch into our office and they were by far the best vendor we've worked with. The food was very fresh and delicious, and the staff were super nice. I highly recommend them!
author: Sina M.

description: Amazing lunch. Love this place. Come at least once a week and change up the order every time.
author: Trevor C.

description:
Credo is a convenient, albeit pricey, place in the FiDi area for group dining.

APPETIZERS -- The GOAT CHEESE paired well with the crostini and it was so creamy. The BURRATA was also good with the honey drizzled on top, but it wasn't outstanding. And who can say no to carbolicious free bread?!

ENTREES -- I went with the LINGUINE and it had fresh clams, although they were a bit sandy and the dish was overall salty. My party and I noticed that the portions were rather small, but I guess that's what we get for being in FiDi.

DRINKS -- Specialty cocktails were strong and they have an extensive wine list. My chardonnay paired well with my linguine.

It was easy to get a reservation for a group of 10 less than a week away. However, it took a very long time for the waiter to take our order, despite the restaurant being less than half full on a weekend night. Just be aware the SERVICE will be a bit slow, so be prepared to lounge around.

Other things to note:
- Watch out for the step by the front door! I almost fell down as we were exiting the restaurant, which is scary since I just broke my foot a few months ago. This place is NOT ADA FRIENDLY.
- Restrooms are wayyyy downstairs, so again...be careful!
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
This space is quite noisy at lunch. We were pleased that they took reservations for a group. However, I was surprised at how spotty the service was. Main courses arrived synchronously, but after-lunch coffee took a long time and came out after dessert. Waiters tripped over each other, fell into our table, had their hands in food, and practically threw some if the appetizers at us.

The food was fine, if on the rich side (our ordering was partially at fAult for that, of course). The baked polenta was surprisingly tasty, likely due to all the cheese & some mushrooms in it, while the meatballs were too bland. I'd have preferred the burrata without honey. I had the short rib special , which was nice and tender and has great roasted vegetables with it. The sea bass special had a really nice crust to it. Overall, the mains seemed substantially better than the pizza.

I liked that the desserts were a pretty manageable size. The brioche bread pudding was good and for once I enjoyed the creme anglaise with it.
author: Lisa K.

description: We went here for my nephew's Birthday today, we left feeling incredibly grateful. From the amazing service to the amazing food, everything was great! We had such a good time there, I'm glad we decided to go here to celebrate his birthday. Brandon the Manger, Jeremy the assistant  Manager, Alex our server and Kelly were fantastic!  We will for sure be coming back! Exceptional service, food, atmosphere and people at this restaurant  10 starts if I could!
author: Alejandra A.

description: Had the pleasure of dining at Credo last week Friday 8/18 while we were visiting San Francisco on Vacation.  What a pleasant surprise this restaurant ended up being.  First the decor is like being in a cool contemporary art gallery.  Found myself reading the walls and being inspired.  But let us not forget what we came for.  The FOOD.  The menu is a great blent of Californian and Italian cuisine.  Light with bold and fresh flavors.  Highly recommend the salmon dish.  Our server was extremely professional with out being stuffy.  Shared great deal info about the area which improved our visit to the bay area.  Chef Larry even stopped by the table to check on us, which is always a nice touch.  OH! don't forget to save room for the dessert.  The chocolate cake is amazing.
author: Levent E.

description:
A solid 4 stars for this place.

For appetizers that were delicious:
Pork and ricotta meatballs
The Burratta with crostini

For entrees the pasta dishes were a good portion size and not overly filling:

The chicken and Parmesan meatballs - yum!
The linguine with clams - out of bounds! 

The service was attentive but the server forgot to bring me a refill of my tea even though I asked twice.
author: Darren F.

description: We had the lemon fettuccine and penne pizza crust bowl. Both were very good. Fettuccine was not the traditional noodle. Much wider and thinner than I expected. Unique twist on Italian food.
author: Lori J.

description:
We visited this restaurant for the first time with a group of seven. Rather than ordering entrees we followed the suggestion of the wonderful server (Sabrina) and ordered a variety of small and medium plates, one large plate, and several desserts - all to share.  It was a GREAT suggestion as we got to taste so many delicious foods! By the end of the evening, we were WOWED by the experience. I will list all the selections we tried at the end of the review.

The restaurant has a very cool vibe with walls of quotes from every side of the aisle and all walks of life (Credo = I believe). They also serve as conversation starters. When we arrived for an early dinner (6:00 pm on a Sat night) there were plenty of seats but by the time we left, the place was packed. The service was very attentive and the food just kept coming. There is a full bar and the wine selections provide a lot of choices. I could see this becoming a great local spot where you become a regular and the staff knows your name. 

The stars from our small plates included the Burrata (oh so creamy!), the roasted Brussels sprouts, roasted baby artichokes, the fava bean crostini with pecorino, and the pork/ricotta  meatballs.
 
Next were the medium plates: the hands down favorite was the pumpkin gnocchi. Added to that were a delicious chopped salad (really fresh!) and a mushroom pizza that we also loved. 

We decided to order one large plate just so we could taste the New York steak with the roasted potatoes, spinach and salsa verde. It sounded so good on the menu and it was the perfect finale to our shared meal. 

All that and we still had a little room for dessert. The one selection that we had to try and LOVED was the cookies and milk - the selection of cookies was right out of the oven and were the epitome of comfort food.The tiramisu was outstanding as was the chocolate budino (a rich delicious pudding). 

We can't wait to visit this restaurant again. The hard part will be deciding what to eat since there were many items we did not try and many that we would want to order for a second time!
author: Patricia I.

description:
I came here with a group of people from work. We had a reservation so we were seated right away. The hostess was nice and the atmosphere was casual. 

I had never been here before, but others from my work raved about the food. Since I'm a big Yelper, I had my doubts given the rating and reviews. Yelp of course was spot on.

The meatballs were flavorless and our table didn't come near to finishing the two orders we had. I will say that the goat cheese app and rigatoni that I ordered were delicious!

What killed me once our service. Our waiter was beyond rude and never smiled or even pretended to be nice. He was short and no where to be found most of the night. We had to constantly ask him for refills or things he forgot. 

This is someplace I will definitely not go out of my way to visit when I'm in SF.
author: Kristy P.

description:
My husband had to fly to San Francisco for business, and I was given the privilege of joining him.  One night, we went to Credo for dinner.
Beautiful interior, with quotes on the wall from famous people.
I ordered the maitake mushroom with polenta wild rice cake, spinach and pine nut pesto.  So good!  My husband got the linguini with clams.  He was not quite as thrilled with his entree as I was with mine, but he still enjoyed it.
If we ever get to travel to San Francisco again, I would like to stop by for dinner again.
author: Robin C.

description: One of our go-to lunch spots... Heavy or light, there is something for everyone.  Not to be missed... Crostini... they change seasonally, getting better and better each time. My personal go-to is the chopped salad.  Lovely staff, even on the craziest of lunch hours.  Sneak in for happy hour for great drinks and bites.
author: Ali G.

description: Business lunch today and the food was unreal. Everything was amazing including the wait staff. We will be back.
author: Robert P.

description:
I come here regularly for business and they're generally great. They are used to getting people in and out on their lunch hour. Everything I've had has been great, from the burrata to the chicken and sage meatballs to the desserts.

However, when I was taking my team out to lunch one day the server put the check down in front of the man at the table, not me. Awkward, not sure why he didn't put it in the middle of the table for a group. Don't assume that a man always pays!
author: Alissa S.

description:
A review based on random thoughts:

- I had the Garganell with chicken, prosciutto, sage meatballs, snap peas & parmesan cream. It was pretty good. I cant pronounce half the stuff on the menu (with my 2nd grade reading level)

- Empty on a Friday night: I suspect this has partially to do with the location and food. The food isn't good enough to go out of the way for and there's not a ton of nightlife in the area.

- Tons of offices nearby so it's probably crazy busy during lunch. I've only dined in when I bring interview candidates to lunch but we've always had a reservation.

- I'm not sure if they stock a full bar but their bar was indeed well stocked. The bartender seemed nice and poured beers well. I haven't tested his mixology ability or creativity so I can't speak on that. 

Definitely a nice lunchtime place. I wouldn't take a date, client or superior in fear of embarrassing myself with that menu.
author: Chris W.

description: Pizza meets Pot Pie, wonderful dish, really recommend it, particularly for children.  Lemonade also really good.
author: Lewis C.

description:
Definitely an above average find, and one I would return to again for a business dinner; however, I wouldn't return on my own dime because of the price to value/flavor.

* Complimentary bread: Decent bread, enjoyed the sea salt butter to top.

* Calamari - 2 STARS: Lacked flavor, overly breaded, tasted old. It was shared amongst about 10 people and was left unfinished.

* Burrata with Tuscan Honey and Sea Salt ($9) - 4 STARS: A good burrata is good no matter what you put on it. I think it was an interesting combination of honey and cheese, but I preferred to eat it plain than with the crostini.

* Berkshire Proscuitto ($12) - 3.5 STARS: Pretty good, but for the portion of meat I felt it was pretty stingy.

* Pork and Ricotto Meatballs ($9) - 4 STARS: I typically dislike polento for it's gelatinous texture, but it was a perfect complement to the homemade tasting meatballs. A great sharing dish.

* Pork Chop - 4 STARS: So, the porkchop was quite delicious, despite my having been to NOPA just a week before. As a porkchop snob, I can admit the seasoning and execution of this bone-in chop was excellent; however, the quality of the chop itself was not as high quality (thick, fatty, tender, etc) as Nopa or Seven Hills. The accompanying side of kale was way too sweet. Almost inedible.

* Bittersweet Chocolate Cake with Vanilla Crema ($7) - 5 STARS: Your traditional molten chocolate cake. Very similar to what you might have at Roy's.

* Yogurt Panna Cotta ($7) - 4 STARS: I also am a panna cotta fiend and this was delicious. Just the right amount of vanilla bean and bouncy texture. Wasn't a huge fan of the grapefruit topping, but it was still good.

* Chocolate cake with graham cracker crust ($7) - 2 STARS: This was more of a chocolate tarte with chocolate ganache. Very decadent and sweet. Not my favorite.

* Olive oil cake ($7) - 1.5 STAR: I have had many olive oil cakes and this wasn't my favorite.

* Almond Cake ($7) - 1 STAR: So. Dry. Really?

Great place for business dinner or lunch (totally empty), but not my top choice for Italian in SF.
author: Jess C.

description: EVERYTHING was great. We had butternut squash crostini appetizer - completely delicious. Fascinating combo of textures and flavors - crunchy, creamy, sweet, tart. Broccoli rabe pizza with fontina cheese -- amazingly delicious. Savoy spinach with lemon seemed so-so until we squoze the lemon onto the spinach, then it was green veggie heaven. This is a favorite financial district lunch spot, so avoid noon to one if you can.
author: Helen H.

description: I was blown away by the presentation and flavor profiles of the food. Must get the baked pecorino to start your meal and then follow that up with the octopus salad.
author: Ashley K.

description: This is our first time visiting here and we ordered tagliatelle, kale salad and octopus plate. Everything was fantastic!!! To be honest, we didn't expect the food to be this good. The bartender was great here as well. We will definitely come back here. Note- this place is less noisy than the average so for those who want to chat, I highly recommend!
author: Haruka Y.

description:
Was so excited to try this place, having heard soma my good things about it. I must say I was a bit disappointed. 

Ambiance was great and fun for a Wednesday night. The service was perfect. The beers cold and delicious. The appetizers were absolutely perfect. 

But I came here for the main dish. I ordered porchetta. After eating the best porchetta in the world in Italy itself, I was not expecting a similar experience. It wouldn't be fair. But I was hoping for similar flavors and soft textures. 

No luck. My pork was salty and dry inside. Overall, not a bad meal, but not what I paid for. 

I will return to try other dishes though, I have the feeling there is some genius options there.
author: Rob G.

description:
I came here with my team for lunch just last week. We made reservations a week in advance for a group of 15(?) and we were seated in their private dining space downstairs. I really liked this room. If I was hosting a fancy party, I'd definitely consider renting out the space. I think it's $1500 food & beverage minimum for lunch or dinner and they have a few options to choose from. 

The lunch we had was better than expected. I really liked the appetizers! 
We got the prosciutto  with melon and the brussel sprouts. Both were amazing. I was surprised to find the prosciutto and honeydew actually matched well together. 

For my main, I ordered the halibut. I think the halibut was pretty good. I liked the appetizers a little more than the main though. That's usually the case for restaurants like these. 

I also got some of their cocktails. The waitress offered the make the strawberry cocktail without sugar for me and it was delicious. I highly recommend it. Not sure what it's like normally but I don't even think they need to add any sugar to that drink =P
author: Annie Z.

description: Met girlfriends here for dinner and didn't know what to expect. We'd all heard of the place but had never tried the food. We were all blown away with the plates we ordered and the attentive service! We highly recommend the meatballs - they melt in your mouth (and this means a lot coming from me who typically doesn't like red meat), the today's special risotto and the halibut which was to die for! The drinks were a bonus. Will definitely find myself here a lot more often!
author: Cecelia M.

description:
I went there once for dinner with a fairly big group. The server was very friendly, the decor was nice and we had reservations, but didn't have to wait at all on a Saturday night. 

We all got the Gnocchi, braised short ribs, muscles with chorizo (appetizer), chicken lasagna, burrata (appetizer), broccolini cooked in chili oil, Tuscan kale salad, salt Codd fritters and a few more things I didn't try. That is in order of what I liked the most first. I've never had gnocchi before, but that was AMAZING. The mixture of the duck and the sweetness of the pomegranate seeds really made all the flavors pop, but wasn't too heavy. We also got the kicking mule (alcoholic drink) that wasn't too sweet, light, and not too strong. 

The only reason why I don't give 5 stars is because it's a little pricey (but you kind of have to expect that in the city). They also took a while to get waters out and messed up on one of the orders, but the waiter more than made up for it. 

Overall, I would definitely go back again. The food was delicious!
author: Sydney N.

description: Credo has some of the best dishes! The baked pecorino is amazing for an appetizer...a sweet, savory, cheesy crowd-pleaser! I love the spring vegetable risotto with the seared sea scallops...I mean I love scallops, but these were exceptional! And usually I would say that's enough, but save room for dessert because the strawberry shortcake with mint is AMAZING! Can't say enough about the food! The staff is attentive and always make sure your wine glass is full...come check it out!
author: Ashley J.

description:
Reliably good Italian food--not pretentious, absolutely delicious, comforting and reasonably priced. On a Saturday night, the restaurant was only 80% full, and service was timely and friendly. 
We shared the mussels and corn pizza from the seasonal menu, and the porchetta from the main menu. All were delightful, solidly good food - from the flavorful pizza crusts to the in-season ingredients. 

The best part of Credo is the cocktail menu. I highly recommend the pineapple caipirinha and mezcal Paloma cocktails. At the end the meal, they offered "coffee, tea or shots"--a very unique and effective way to keep us at Credo a title longer. (Spoiler alert: we got shots.) We will definitely come back!
author: Jenna C.

description: We got there at 5 and able to get happy hour drinks ($3 off regular price).  We got the shrimp appetizer and it was amazing!! $19 for 4 prawns... pricey but delicious. We got the deboned petrale sole ($29) and the waiter took all the bones out at the table which was fun to watch. My bf loved the gravy/sauce they poured over the fish after it was deboned. I got the clam linguini and it was so salty... almost inedible. But I paid $25 for it... so I ate it with the table bread. It wasn't the best meal for me. If you ask my boyfriend, he definitely enjoyed it more. He gives them 3.5-4 stars out of 5. I'm sticking to my 2.5 stars. Good shrimp and drinks but bad main entree. Waitstaff was amazing though and loved the ambience. It was quiet when we first got there and easy to hold a conversation but as soon as six rolled around the place had a lot more people and it felt like I had to shout to be heard at my table. Fun quotes - probably good for a first date. If you get bored of your date you can be entertained by the restaurant walls.
author: Azeena H.

description: Great food and quickly sat during busy lunch time.   I had the salmon which was tasty.   The GM came by to check in us.
author: Dennis H.

description: Seriously, this place is fabulous.  I can't even think of anything negative.  The menu is put together with such creativity.  The pairings are deliciously appealing.  Must do the olives first thing.  I will certainly try the savoy spinach with charred lemon next time.  I can't imagine anything less than Amazing at Credo.  Telling my traveling friends that this is a Must!!
author: Laura P.

description:
Waited fifteen minutes on the patio to be served around 3pm, while both servers hung out chatting at the bar with no customers inside. When I finally went inside to ask for a menu, was told by the manager that I could just order outside, so I laughed and said "I'd rather just order here."

We waited another ten minutes for my salad ala carte (since I was out of time to eat there), then got back to my office and ate three bites before finding a lengthy hair in the salad and threw it out. 

30 minutes and $20 later, I've decided I will not be returning.
author: Matt T.

description: The sea bass (European) was awful. The waiter also did not know the difference between European sea bass and Chilean sea bass.
author: Ryan L.

description: Recently visited Credo and absolutely loved it. The food I ordered arrived very quickly and it was delish!! The service was great and the baked pecorino was like cheese heaven, must try!
author: Ana T.

description:
Interesting atmosphere. Huge boards with interesting historical and contemporary quotes on history. The women's bathroom had President John Kennedy speech at Berlin Wall. Great place if you have to edit for someone or want to arrive early. We came for dinner on a week night. 
Now on to the food . Great bourbon cocktail. Grilled octopus appetizer quite disappointing. Lacked freshness and flavor but the soup and entrees very good. 
A puréed soup of greens- kale , spinach, not sure what else with garlic puréed without cream. Fresh Parmesan in the soup bowl with some pieces of broccolini. Hot soup poured over- table side. Nice starter. 
Our group had linguini with fresh clams , tomatoes, white wine , garlic - fresh and tasty. 
Pork chop over bed of couscous and sautéed greens - generous portion and good. 
I rarely order gnocchi but this sounded great and was. 
Soft and pillowy gnocchi with sautéed chanterelles, grilled smoked corn in a truffle broth with a touch of cream. Unique and delicious.
author: Vicki H.

description: Regularly hold business lunches here and can't recommend it enough.  The staff is professional, thoughtful, and does a great job of reading guests.  I can have a 2 hour lunch with a friend or be out in one hour with a colleague.  Food is amazing. Pastas are off the charts.
author: Michelle C.

description: Great food, great service! Great place to host an after work happy hour or host a client dinner in their downstairs private room. Get the risotto.
author: Sheldon G.

description: Another wonderful meal at this unique place in the heart of SF.  Tasted three new appetizers:  fried green tomatoes with a terrific blue cheese dipping sauce, root vegetable salad and brussel sprouts.  Our friends had never been here before and were really impressed.  Great experience
author: julie f.

description: A decent place for dinner with friends in the Financial District. Fairly expensive, and portions are kind of small, but still fun and good, modern atmosphere. It'll definitely be an option next time I am in the area.
author: Aviah M.

description: Good Service and atmosphere. Parking is near impossible like all SF places. Good lunch spot. Chopped salad
author: Michael L.

description: Ate here just because we were in the area and it was open later than other places, and ended up being a great choice!  The food and drink were delicious, and service was excellent.  We were seated and waited on by Jeremy, who was very professional and friendly.  When there was a slight delay getting my drink he even comped it, even though we said it was really no problem.  So nice!  We were there only about 45 minutes before they closed but in no way felt rushed.  Great place, highly recommend.
author: Yun Z.

description:
Perfect for a nicer business lunch or dinner without it becoming TOO formal, but still have some elegance. Have been there several times and don't plan to stop any time soon. Well worth checking out. 

The food is great (that whole wheat pappardelle!), and the staff is even better. Really friendly crew working there and their new GM Brandon is a great addition helping make me a repeat customer!
author: Robert W.

description: Great food! New chef! Great wine list and an excellent spot for date night. Try the broccolini rabe, margherita pizza, pumpkin gnocchi, and a barrel aged negroni. Makes you wanna lick your plate.
author: Anna T.

description:
Best part of the meal: burrata. I would come here for that alone. 

Also got some garganelli pasta and love how the pasta is so chewy. My friend got a bolognese and everything was really solid. It's a bit on the pricier end, but hit the spot nonetheless. 

Service was a bit slow here though...felt like we were always trying to stare a waiter down. Will be a go-to for pasta.
author: Annie S.

description: Credo is great! Great service and great food. Definitely try the housemate lemonade! The Sedanini is a delicious experience! All in all credo is definitely the pasta go to!
author: Smriti S.

description:
I had a great experience at Credo.  Maybe it was a fluke?  Hopefully not, because I'd like to dine here in the near future.

I wanted to take my sis out to see the Bay Lights before she headed back to SoCal.  My mom tagged along since dining with her daughters was a better option than waiting for a bus to head home to the Central Valley.  I wanted to eat at Credo because I saw it on Check Please and I pass by it almost every day.

As an appetizer, we ordered the roasted carrots and an arugula salad.  The carrots were my favorite, and definitely the highlight of the experience.  They came with hazelnuts and this buttery-nutty sauce...I ended up dipping my bread in it because it was so good.  The salad had dates, tossed with almonds in a vinaigrette.  The dates were very sweet, and I had to eat it with the arugula to balance out the flavor.

Then came the pizza!  We got the magherita pizza and a spinach pizza.  Both were really good, but I really liked the magherita.  The crust was thin, crunchy on the outside yet doughy on the inside.  One pizza is enough for one person; however, if you're the type that gets full easily, then there would be enough to share.  

To finish the dining experience, we ordered the meyer lemon panna cotta, topped with strawberries.  It was a sweet cleansing to the heaviness of the meal.

Service was friendly.  I just want to say that the waiter was funny... not only was it Black Friday, but my sister and I no longer eat meat.  When our waiter asked how the meal was, we said it was fantastic.. and he commented that it was meat-free in a surprising tone!  Yes, a meal can be great without the use of meat.. lol.

I also like the decor.. I feel like it's something I'd see in the Mission for some reason.. maybe it's because of all the progressive quotes and how they're laid out.  And you won't miss out on any quotes in the bathroom as the wallpaper is full of it.  It's kind of creepy that speeches are played in the bathroom.. It kind of creeps me out in a claustrophobic sort of way.

I had a great time here and impressed my family.  I hope to come here again with friends to see what they think.
author: Vira P.

description: I like this restaurant usually. It's pretty noisy and small, but close to my office. We had a very rude waiter last time. This has never happened before. I asked for a latte. He responds espresso machine is broken. Offers no other options, just stands there. He was a man of very few words. No hello, how are you, etc. We barely saw him after he rushed us to order. Someone else brought food and the busboy basically waited on us. He was very polite and attentive. I watched our waiter just hang by the bar. Oh, he did move to drop off our check!
author: Colleen C.

description: The best pork chop I've ever had in my life!! It was very juicy and flavorful. The pasta, mushroom, and veggie medley was the perfect complement to it. My boyfriend's "pizza pasta," was phenomenal as well! We weren't big fans of the fig and Gorgonzola appetizer. The wine (house Pinot noir) was delicious.
author: Jacquie H.

description:
Thank good this was on company's dime!
Mushroom soup was bitter and taste like herbal medicine.
Spinach salad was good two stars that is why I gave this many stars! 
The streak was chewy and so rough and for the price you got sizzlers steak.
It was too salty and I wished I sent it back. I was with the boss and it would look bad but heck all I was thinking was thank god I wasn't paying! I wanted to try and thank goodness I won't be back!
Shame on you Credo ! No quality checks tonight.
author: Alison W.

description: Great food. Creative cocktails.  Excellent service. A must try !!  Service was great.  They knew what to recommend. And they were right.  Excellent location.
author: Sandra H.

description:
Good food, good service - out the door in 60 mins - yay! Great spot for lunch. I usually order the pasta dish that starts with a t (not even going to try to spell it here). The burrata is tasty also, I could probably eat it all myself. 
It's a busy spot, so yea- the servers are really busy, running around. You might not get super fast service, but it's not like the staff is idle. If you want fast food- go to a fast food restaurant. I like this place and I'm definitely going back.
author: Cindy D.

description: Wow. Food is delicious.  Meatballs chopped salad not to be missed.  Was greeted by all members of staff.  Manager made sure my wine glass was never empty.  Great atmosphere.  Will be back
author: Marty H.

description: King salmon was great but nothing too special. Margherita pizza was below average. Probably a little over priced overall
author: Rohan S.

description: We went here for the first time yesterday nite. The bartender was really nice and made us custom cocktails after enquiring about our tastes. My friend and me both loved our drinks. Staff are very courteous as well. Nice boutique place to have couple of drinks. The quotes on the wall decor are fun to read!
author: Sireesha G.

description: This is probably one of my favorite restaurants in the city! I have lived in the city for years and keep coming back again. Props to the chef!
author: Olivia P.

description:
Ate there Saturday eve as we could not find another choice in the neighborhood.  The food was pretty good - nothing special.  Service uninspired.  

The wine list is certainly expensive.  Usually, I order one of the less expensive ones and did so here, a Cab for $48.  The waiter returned several minutes later saying that it was all gone.  He recommended another Cab which he claimed was in the "same price range."  It ended up costing $61, not enough to send me to the poorhouse, bit not the same price range.  It wasn't very good.  One would expect that the place would eat the difference.  They didn't.  Little things like that make me never return and encourage others to look elsewhere.


Within a few minutes of my posting this, I received most apologetic response from the CEO of the restaurants parent company. I've been exchanged emails with the manager of the restaurant.  He offered me to come and bring a guest to make up for their error. I asked them instead to send the money to my favorite charity, the ACLU.  Not only did they do so, they offered to send the charity 15% of their receipt for a given day, including a nice some in my name.

I am tremendously impressed by their decision and I'm certain that I will be returning to the restaurant.
author: Larry H.

description: Great lunch spot for a nice, casual lunch with great food and service. Great menu and drink selection as well. The GM was highly knowledgeable about the menu and recommended a great wine pairing to go with our meal.
author: Michael F.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in the fidi or downtown area and is a long overdue review. They offer great light Italian food, great drink menu, and fast and courteous service. The burrata is to die for, along with any of their main entrees. Not only do I come here for a dinner with my wife, but also is a great spot for happy hour with plenty of seating and even large parties. They also offer a great dining space downstairs that can be rented out for larger parties. Brandon and Jeremy have both helped me with reservations time and time again and are both extremely knowledgeable of the food and wine menu!
author: Ryan G.

description:
Previously I had lunch here as a part of a luncheon for work and liked dining here enough to come back for my birthday lunch with my co-workers. However, after yesterday, I was left with the feeling of regret and disappointment after my time spent here.

After checking in with the hostess, she asked us to follow her to our table. Along the way she stopped to talk to our server to walk us downstairs to our table. He seemed not interested in doing this, but he did it anyways. After we sat down, he didn't really take drink orders. He only asked a few of us in my group but no everyone. He didn't introduce himself as well. After placing our orders and giving us bread with butter, he barely made any effort to come back to check on our table. The food was okay, it could've been better. The food was warm but no hot. I think it was the lack in service that made the food not taste not so good. Beyond getting our food, service didn't get any better after this. 

After taking some time to think about my experience, our server made it seem like we were something to-do. Aside from the service, Credo has the potential to be a great place to have a lunch or dinner. However I WILL NOT be coming back for either. I didn't have a great time here and even my co-workers I was with felt the same way afterwards.
author: Serg O.

description: I rarely write reviews, but I had such a great meal at Credo I felt compelled to.  Everything from the food, to the staff and the overall ambiance was amazing.  Looking forward to next time I am in town so I can dine here again!
author: Sean S.

description:
When one of my best friends asked me to help him find a restaurant just a few hours before his birthday dinner was supposed to start (thanks again for the late notice man...haha), I scoured the Open Table app for restaurants with available tables.  After skimming through the menus of a few places, I ended up going with Credo since I remembered a couple of my friends mentioning them to me.  Even though I couldn't remember if they liked the place, I figured why not.  With so little time to work with, beggers can't be choosers, right? 

Just from walking into the restaurant, I really liked the feel and décor of Credo.  Between how open the space was and the quotes they had sprawled across the walls, it just felt like there was a good vibe in the air.  Although the menu wasn't extensive, a number of their dishes sounded pretty interesting, including the Sedanini alla Credo a couple of my friends ordered (Mezzi rigatoni, calabrese sausage, pancetta, sage, pecorino, and tomato, topped with pizza dough and baked...seen here: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iXjbvsGyhGttLRaV6shP1g?select=2s2g4OmC5A7fdz3gnyDWEw).  However, I decided to go with the Osso Bucco di Malale (Braised Pork Shank with Maitake Mushrooms, served on Farro Risotto) since it sounded a little more enticing to me.

When my order was brought out, it looked great (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iXjbvsGyhGttLRaV6shP1g?select=3JPPV6ocysRmJwbbh9x8cw).  The meat was tender, and I really liked the sauce on the dish (mostly because of the maitake mushrooms...yum).  Sadly though, I didn't think the shank had enough flavor, especially from the sauce.  Instead, most of the flavor seemed to be coming from whatever herb they used to cook it with.  I still can't put my finger on what type it was, but I didn't care for it.  As for the risotto, it was pretty good, but it didn't have the usual creaminess.  Instead, the farro gave it a slightly "rough" texture (sort of like brown rice or oats).  Nothing wrong with that, just different than what you might expect when you see "risotto" on the menu.

While the Osso Bucco was fine for the most part (I picked out that herb every time I saw it), I'd say the three and a half average Credo has is about right.  Since the service didn't really do it for me though, I'm rounding down to three.  Even though the waitress who helped bring the dishes to our table was fine, our original waiter seemed to disappear whenever we needed something.  Other than to greet us and take our order, I don't remember seeing him come by the table it came time to collect our bill.  Kudos to the owners though for teaming up with different non-profits and organizations to help raise money for their causes.
author: Mike L.

description:
I love Italian cuisine, a group of us met at Credo for lunch, on a busy Friday. Friends had recommended it for their lovely pastas and pizzas. our group tried a bunch of appetizers before enjoying our entrees.
The standout dishes:
-  The octopus with olives, cherry tomatoes, potato was hands down one of the best dishes I have had in a long time. The octopus melted in your mouth, wow, good job Chef!!
- The meatballs had so much flavor which balanced out with the polenta, it was such a homey dish, I will be ordering this dish the next time I stop by
- The lemon fettuccine with crab was cooked to perfection! the flavors didn't over power and balanced each other out.
The service:
Everyone was attentive and really seemed to know the food, sequence of service and overall really pleasant.
I will definitely tell friends about this cute spot in the financial district!! Keep up the good work!!
author: Meena R.

description: I normally love Credo so I reserved dinner for 10 people for a work dinner. We experienced the worst service ever! Our dinner reservation was at 7. We arrived early around 6:45 and our table was beautifully set up. Our waitress took our drink orders at around 7:20. 4 people had to reorder their drinks 2-3 times because she kept forgetting which seemed off as we were one of 3 parties in the entire restaurant. We got our appetizers around 7:45 pm after we had ordered them along with our drinks and did not end up eating dinner until close to 9 pm. It was a terrible experience. The waitress was completely inattentive. Credo has always been a great experience with great food and service, but this visit was a sad disappointment.
author: Elle C.

description: This was one of my best dining experiences in SF. I came here to celebrate my son Atticus' birthday. We both got the trout because he loves fish, and I must say the chef cooked it to perfection. I also ordered the Risotto which really complemented the trout. Our server was so friendly and very prompt. I can't wait to go back!
author: Andrew I.

description: Good food. Interesting atmosphere (if interested in the rise and fall of socialism). Poor bedside manner. Turning up the lights at 10:15 in SF on a Friday night? Bad move. Won't be returning
author: Spencer S.

description: I ordered a pizza and it was very delicious! It's a good sized pizza where I finished it all, and was left very full. Wonderful service as well.
author: Bertina Z.

description: Decided to dine on a self-built three course meal along with a couple cocktails. The app I had set the standard of the rest of the meal: freaking delicious! I had the blue prawns...they are literally bathed in a butter sauce that make it an amazing dish! I soaked up all the sauce with the provided bread which, of course, enhanced the taste of the prawns. For a entree was is considered a 'medium dish', I had the octopus which was also delicious. The end the meal I had the tasty panna cotta...literally cleaned all the plates by myself! The crafted cocktails (Buddha's Hand & Guava Pimms Cup) were also amazing! The manager on duty, Jeremy Wong, was very attentive and extremely helpful/friendly. I highly recommend this place to everyone!!
author: Josh A.

description:
Sometimes, the simple places are the best.  This place is quiant, modern, quiet, clean, dressed in different writings and pieces on the walls, sports an open view kitchen, and a beautifully designed and stocked bar.  Great place for HH, to casually sit back and enjoy a cocktail after your monstrous day at work, or even have a wonderful dinner with one of their signature dishes.  

The pizzas here are amazingly good.  Pick one, any one and get lost in a food paradise that makes you think you were someone in Europe instead of a restaurant in the middle of San Francisco Financial District.  Don't be intimidated by the clientele; power suits, power ties, and power steering is how we all look like here, but this place's vibe is definitely casual and open to all people.  Come treat yourself today.  You won't regret it.
author: Myke Y.

description: I came to wait for some friends after work and ordered a Chardonnay with a Cesar salad. It was all delicious with super attentive bartenders. I'll definitely be back and would recommend for lunch or a chill indoor happy hour.
author: Darija W.

description: This is a great restaurant that often lends its beautiful space to nonprofit organizations in the area.  Not only is the service and staff super friendly, they helped offer complimentary drinks and even give 20% of Friday night proceeds to charity.  The food was also delicious! Loved the pizzas, appetizers, and charcuterie..the meatballs are wonderful as are the cheeses.  I would definitely come back and recommend to others.
author: Christina K.

description:
Got to meet one of the chefs. He provided some suggestions on what to order.

Each dish was excellent and savoring.  Each dish we ordered complimented each other. The chef's creativity with the dish is very evident.  The order the item came out enhances our taste palate and tasting the intensity of the favor of each dish. The ingredients were fresh... I'm surprise with the octopus how it was not rubbery, but it was tender and moist. For a second, I thought I was eating bacon or pork belly. Interesting flavor...... The flavor was sweet and rich. It added additional flavor to the Brussels sprout. 
Overall, it was a fabulous experience. I will recommend to others and return.
author: Theresa T.

description:
I came here on May 28th for dinner with my cousin. He had been here before, so he knew what to expect. I had no idea what to expect. When I first walked in, I could tell i was way under dressed. I had on shorts and my warriors shirt. Everyone here was in business casual attire. When you come here dress decently. 

After walking inside, we got seated because we had a 6:15 reservation. It seemed pretty crowded, I do recommend getting a reservation. The service here was absolutely amazing. As soon as we got seated we were helped by one of the friendly and knowledgeable waiters. He knew the menu basically inside and out as a good waiter should. All the questions I had, he was able to answer quickly. 

I ordered the tagliatelle with homemade bolognese sauce. With every bolognese sauce you know what to expect. A rich and creamy sauce with some meaty chunks. This was exactly what it was. I didn't know what tagliatelle was before I came here, but the waiter was able to tell me what it was. My cousin had the lasagna with chicken, mushrooms, bechamel, herbs, parmesan,& tomato sauce. He said his lasagna was amazing and he has had it before and would keep ordering it if he came here again. My tagliatelle was absolutely amazing. It was cooked "al dente" which pasta should always be cooked. 

I didn't think I would have enough room in my stomach for dessert, but once I saw this specific dessert, I immediately opened up a little spot for it. I had the chocolate ganache tart, with bourbon caramel, and a toasted marshmallow. It was basically their take on s'mores. It was so rich and creamy and amazing. The marshmallow was definitely cooked perfectly. It was soft like in a s'more. The chocolate wasn't melted, but warm enough. It had a graham cracker type of crust. The bourbon caramel was amazing as well. You could definitely taste the bourbon in the caramel. It was all great compliments of each other. 

I would definitely come back here if I was in the area. I will definitely try the lasagna next time I come here. I would definitely keep having the chocolate ganache tart because I love chocolate and marshmallows. I would definitely recommend this place to other people.
author: Avi W.

description: Overpriced and pretentious.  The mushroom risotto at 28 dollars for a half a bowl was flavorless and quite a disappointment given it was the most recommended meal by the wait staff.  The 7 dollar beers, the multitude of quotes on the walls and the free sourdough bread were the highlights of our 130 meal for 3 people.
author: Debbie W.

description:
I was really looking forward to lunch here, but was a little disappointed. The ambiance is friendly and relaxed, with nice, clean, light modern decor.  It took quite a while for anyone to come greet our table, and the service throughout the lunch was pretty hands-off, to put it nicely. One of our starters was a bruschetta, which was tasty, but not what I'm used to. It was served separately, so you scooped the huge chunks of tomato onto the crostini yourself. The tomato was ripe and sweet, but I didn't taste any garlic or, well, anything but the fresh tomato. 
My stuffed mezza luna pasta was tasty on the inside, but the pasta was beyond al dente, to the point I'd say a little hard and chewy, which was really disappointing. I would have asked for it to be replaced if any servers would have ever come to check on how the meal was going. Seems many like this place, so maybe it was an off day.  But when both service and food are lacking and you are paying an above average price, it doesn't inspire a return visit.
author: Angie H.

description:
A sign of great food is clean plates all around. The food here is really top notch, you can tell the chefs thought about the flavor profiles.

 I had the stuffed chicken which I feared would be dry but it was moist   nice salted from the bacon. Dessert was kind of neat too; we got to pour (or, per menu description)  "smother" our ice cream in actual espresso coffee. Crazy good. 

Service was unsurprisingly excellent, even when our waiter ran our table AND the bar. A bit of an older crowd, definitely on the expensive end, but not all stuffy. 

The wall has incredible quotes. Good conversation started. I like you, Credo.
author: Quinn N.

description:
I came here for a work lunch, we ordered a large majority of the menu and had an awesome time. Here is a breakdown of what we ordered/# of stars per dish:

Appetizers:
-Roasted octopus (4 stars)
-Burrata (5 stars)
-Fried squash blossoms (3 stars - I have come to realize that generally I just don't like fried foods - these didn't "do it" for me, but the sauce was tasty)

Salad:
-Coriander crusted ahi (4 stars - YUM! A little light on greens, but overall great.)

Pizza:
-Seasonal mushroom (5 stars - this was delicious....)

We came right around noon, and it was loud. The noise level increased as the lunchtime crowd came in, but we were still able to have a conversation with a large group. I loved the quotes on the walls, too!
author: Grace M.

description:
Today was my 4th time at Credo and I'm going to repeat what many other reviewers have said... The service here is awful. Not just slow, but downright rude. 

A coworker called 3 times to preorder since we had a meeting and could only stay for a short time. We had all looked at the menu online beforehand. Efficient right? Not for Credo! 

First the menu online doesn't match the daily menu which I respect but they should say that on the phone as we order. They called us back twice to say they didn't have some of the meals and suggested substitutes. Then when we got there, they didn't have the substitutes. Strike 1.

Then when we get to the restaurant and finish eating our preordered apps, they say they don't have our meal orders (which we called in). Weird right?? So a half hour into it, we had to reorder our meals. Strike 2. 

To top it off, our server had an attitude the whole time. Strike 3. 

Sorry Credo, I'm not coming back. I give you  an extra star because I love your scallops.
author: Ashley A.

description: Went here for lunch with my coworkers for our Team Lunch. We got seated right away (downstairs) as my colleague had a reservation. We were the only ones there in the beginning as we were early. As it reaches noon, the area got crowded and noisy which was fine - we were seated at the very corner so it wasn't that bad. We started with some apps : Meatballs - Very tasty but small in portion. Buratta cheese plate  - very fresh and delicious served with some crispy bread on the side and olive oil. For entrees, my colleagues all ordered pasta which all very good. I got their special salmon with some couscous, roasted fennel & preserved tomato. The serving was good. Not too small, not too large. I ate it all! The freshness of the salmon was worth the $27! Why 4? It can get loud especially during peak hours but the food was delicious. Their prices are decent for lunch and dinner so I'll definitely come back here. Perhaps I'll bring my bf here and we can try their pizza!
author: Anna Y.

description:
Been here twice now. Try the salmon and chicken breast. Both are my favorite and top off with the chocolate tart. The burrata is a good starter if you are starving. They also give you bread, taste a little sour, If you like that. 

You never have to wait if you have made reservations and customer service is the best. They had attention to detail and food came in a timely manner.
author: Ameera D.

description:
Well the bathrooms are downstairs. That's super inconvenient.

But, let me just say: EVAN IS AWESOME. There were a few mishaps in our experience (bread came super late, more than one order messed up, etc.) but Evan quickly turned this around. He comped our pizza and brought our table of six people FOUR free deserts! Also, he wasn't defensive at all when we explained what went wrong with our experience. I give Evan 5 stars as our waiter but I give the resto 4 and probably 3 if it weren't for him.

The six of us are in agreement that the food was delicious. The goat cheese was so
Bomb.com it's not even funny. Like is this real!?!!!! I want ten orders to go please!!!!! You MUST order it!!!!!!!!
author: Pri A.

description:
Food was amazing! We had a larger group and tried lots of different dishes and each one was really good. Service was attentive but not intrusive, offered to modify dishes to accommodate the number of people in our party so that each person could try. Wines by the glass are on the expensive side. 

The only thing that I was not thrilled about was trying to get to Credo via car from Potrero Hill during rush hour and find parking. When I called to find out where to park and was told it was street parking and that there 'should be plenty of spaces available' (which of course there were not). I specifically asked if they could recommend a nearby parking garage and she said 'I don't have a car so I do not know'. Later she added that someone told her people could park at 555 Montgomery. 

For those of you looking for parking - go to the Pine Street entrance of 555 Montgomery and park there.
author: Stephanie I.

description: I feel like this restaurants food quality has significantly improved since it first opened. When it opened I went twice and did not enjoy it. So it has taken many years and some incompatible work schedules to force me to try it again. I sure am glad I did. Full house and the service and food both were wonderful. Portions were more satisfyingly large then before. Everyone loved there food and the wine recommendations were on point. I look forward to returning.
author: Anna S.

description:
"Hot coffee please"
"The coffee will be the temperature it is."

Welp. 

Bad waiter aside, the food is really salty and the pop music is loud. +1 star for the cool quotes on the walls!
author: Emmy A.

description:
This place I would say is more trendy then anything else. The decor is fun and modern and the restaurant puts off a nice warmth; the food however, was average. Tried the tuna for the starter which was good but nothing to run home and tell mom about. Had the prawns with the quinoa salad - prawns were cooked nicely, quinoa was a bit bland and the pepper yogurt was not a yogurt at all - rather an average pepper sauce.
All in All this place is Average, but why settle for average when there are sooo many amazing Italian restaurants to choose from.
author: Allie P.

description:
Went to Credo on the advice of a friend and totally loved it. We went with a party of six and had a chance to taste a wide range of dishes. First, a disclosure...I'm a vegetarian. It takes a kitchen that loves food to lavish the care necessary to create a memorable vegetarian meal. We started with crostini with fava beans, delicious, and the asparagus, both green and white, done to perfection. The gnocchi with morels was yummy, and the risotto with spring vegetables was a special...and it was indeed special. Squash blossom pizza with truffle oil had just the right amount of oil, complimenting the pizza without overpowering it.
Others at the table enjoyed the Kauai prawns, Sedanini with sausage, and a steak dish that they said was excellent. Everybody raved about their food.
The staff was really helpful in pairing wines with dinner, and the desserts were as good as the dinner (go for the strawberry shortcake, and the warm cookies with milk will make you miss your mom)
This is a restaurant that cares about the food that leaves their kitchen, and it shows with every bite.
If you're a vegetarian, you'll love the place.
author: Michael G.

description: I've been interested in eating at Credo for quite some time as it looks great from the outside. I was excited when a co-worker suggested we meet there today. The ambiance was ok, as was the service. The noise was extremely loud which made it near to impossible to hold a conversation, and we ate at 11:45. The salads are Lilliputian in size. The Ahi tuna salad came with minced kale and the smallest pieces of Ahi that had little to no flavor. My friend had the seasonal heirloom tomato salad and it looked a lot better. Small pieces of carved white bread are served with butter on a wooden tray. Nice presentation, but the bread had no flavor. Convenient location in the FiDi, but I would never go back!
author: Emily C.

description: Pretty darn good.  The spicing was exquisite.  Delicate flavors vs bold flavors in the dishes.  We will go there again.  The service was great.  The waiter new the menu and was not hesitant to give frank opinions.
author: Robert B.

description: I had 12 noon reservations on a Monday. My friend showed up first and I was 15 minutes late. To my surprise the place wasn't very full. Almost all the two-tops were open. I sat down and we quickly decided on what we wanted to eat but it took awhile for someone to check on us. He supposedly went by before I got there. There were three servers in the place and we were able to flag down the server for our table. He took our order and then we got bread and my sparkling water. My friend had regular water and every time he needed a refill, he had to wave someone over. For whatever reason, being against the wall made it difficult for the bussers to notice us or his empty water glass. They would fill the glasses of the table next to us and not see my friend's nor come by. The food was good but not hot in temperature. We split everything and started with a small Chopped Salad. The portion was rather big so I'm glad we only got the small. It was a fresh salad and I liked the garbanzo beans mixed in. You don't often get beans in a chopped salad. They didn't give us any plates so we used the tiny bread plates. Next up was the seasonal pizza of Artichoke Hearts and Prosciutto. It was tasty but it was luke warm as was the Lamb Rigatoni. We had to ask for plates. Our server sent one thing out at a time and he changed out our last plates without us asking so that was good. I enjoyed having the salad, then pizza followed by the pasta. The portions were right for sharing and we made good choices on the selections. We were satisfied but not stuffed. I just wish the service and the food temperature had been better. I do like the more relaxed atmosphere of the place. It's whimsical with food quotes on the walls. The decor is pleasant and they don't have white tablecloths. They also don't seem to get a lot of blue shirts and ties in the place.
author: Jen L.

description:
Delicious food but service is debatable.

There were multiple large groups and it got quite loud but the food came really fast. We could see them serve the large groups (20+ people) all their food at the same time. This place must be excellent for groups.

Their bread with salted butter was delicious and definitely whet our appetites. 

Rigatoni was absolutely to die for. Perfectly cooked pasta with a great homemade sauce and a slight spice. Absolutely would and will order again. Seasonal speciality short rib was also excellent, although the mashed potatoes became a little too much for the dish. Still amazing though, would definitely go back.

Only shortcoming was their service when we ordered dessert. We ordered the chocolate ganache and they brought us the tiramisu. We corrected the waitress (who gave some sassy looks and complained to the kitchen that we "changed our minds" when we clearly ordered the ganache...) and then another waiter brought us the tiramisu again a few minutes after! When we finally got the ganache though, it was delicious.
author: Byron S.

description: Just had a post valentine dinner at Credo and the food was amazing! As all of my friends know I love to eat and Credo is the place to go for good Italian food. For starters we had the octopus salad and it's to die for, the octopus was very soft and tender that melts in your mouth goes very well with the herb aioli .On top of it we also ordered the the lemon fettuccine with crab, it was tasty and filling! the food was well prepared, nicely presented. For desserts the Tiramisu is a MUST TRY!! You won't disappoint, I promise. :)
author: Azellyn B.

description:
For a neo-Italian restaurant that appears to be trying hard to forge a unique identity in a city full of unique culinary establishments, Credo feels awfully like a suburban mall eatery. I think part of it has to do with the lighting. It's just too damn bright in here. The other I have to admit is the contrived leitmotif of their 3-D wall quotes, all hinging on the mantra, "I believe...", which is the direct translation of the restaurant's name. It's entertaining in the same way fortune cookie messages are after a hearty Cantonese meal, but maybe I have a problem seeing a quote from Gandhi on the same panel as one from Ted Kaczynski. 

Things started promisingly when Jamie W. and I were seated next to the front window this past Friday evening. We admired the Piet Hein Eek-designed tables with geometric designs of scrap wood and also the gunmetal flatware with the curled ends (see photo).
