Even our Diet Cokes came in unique sawed-off wine bottles. Upon our order, we received a small loaf of focaccia on a paddleboard with a serving of olives bathing in their oil (see photo). 

For an appetizer, we shared the $15 Fondue of Wild Mushrooms, a large ramekin filled with steaming hot fontina, crescenza, and mozzarella, all melted together with black truffles and mushrooms. It came with four large crostini already buttered and sprinkled with oregano (see photo). It was easily the most delicious menu item we had that evening. It went downhill when we received our entrees. The ingredients seemed right, but something was off with both our orders. 

Jamie went for the $20 Pappardelle with Wild Boar Ragu and Kalamata Olives (see photo). It was reasonably good but lacked distinct flavor. It just missed seasonings that could have made it more interesting than it was, a dull purplish plate of pasta. I ordered the $29 Liberty Farms Duck Breast, sliced and placed atop a pool of cranberry caponata next to a butternut squash timbale (see photo). It looked right, but it was sadly lukewarm with the cranberries too sweet to enjoy fully as a complement. Plain and simple, the dish simply lacked oomph. 

Our side dish was the $9 Cavolini di Bruxelles e Funghi (Brussels Sprouts with Mushrooms and Pancetta) (see photo). The sprouts were strangely undercooked save a few that looked charred as if they weren't mixed at all on the grill. The pancetta bits were near burnt, so it was left to the mushrooms to save the dish from complete disappointment. Throughout our meal, the waitress's appearances were a bit sporadic starting with a long delay before we could order. When she did come by, she was frankly on automatic pilot. I'm not sure what I believe now. 

FOOD - 3 stars...started strong but then flatlined in a sea of blandness 
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...too-bright lights, interesting decorative touches, plenty to read on the walls 
SERVICE - 3 stars...sporadic and then a bit snippy 
TOTAL - 3 stars...I believe....I believe....I believe they don't own a spice kit here.
author: Ed U.

description: I don't even know where to begin. We hosted an event here in The Archive room and the food was amazing! The service was even better, Evan our server made the night. He really listened to know how we wanted the event and executed it perfectly. The price is not insane, and the space is so cool! I can't wait to go back as a customer instead of hosting an event. We will definitely be hosting events here and a staple when we visit.
author: Jackie C.

description:
I was really underwhelmed here by both the food and the service. Two stars for one of my favorite beers and a great dessert, abject failure otherwise.

Before I came, I looked at the menu online and Credo claimed to have this amazing rigatoni baked with a pizza crust top, but that wasn't on the menu when I went. Really, it was the only reason I chose Credo. I was tired of walking, though, so I settled in and tried to make it work.

I sat down at the bar and had to wait 15 minutes to be acknowledged. I ordered a beer (they have Moretti, which is one of my favorites), then took a look at the menu. A couple of other people got served twice before I got served once, which I found a bit weird.

I settled on one of their special pizzas, then a ravioli with braised short ribs. The pizza was a little too burnt, and the ravioli was flavorless. In theory both of these plates were supposed to be good, but neither was. 

Dessert was great; it was some rhubarb and strawberry tart. I'd go back for a Moretti and a dessert, but with all of the great options in SF I don't see myself coming back.
author: Pinky T.

description: Excellent lunch spot. Good entres and relatively quiet environment for business discussion. There is a dining area in the basement where there are "I Believe" statements on the wall, interesting food and interesting foods for thought!
author: Sean W.

description: Love this place! We've been here several times and every time have left sated and inspired. :-) Several cocktail options to accompany the reading of all of the terrific "credos" on the walls. We almost always start with the poem meatballs. If we stay one the smaller side, then it's Brussel sprouts and potatoes and the octopus. For heavier meals, the fish is always great and the short ribs are delicious. I can honestly say that we haven't tried anything here's that we didn't like, and each meal made that much better by the terrific service we've received. Credo is our go to pre-theater or ballet - we know we will receive prompt professional service and a fantastic meal!
author: Sally K.

description: Really delicious dinner at Credo. Server was very friendly, food was great, atmosphere was nice. Overall really great evening!
author: Deborah G.

description:
Credo opened in January, but you would think they were a San Francisco institution.  Great food, an attentive staff and absolutely packed on a Saturday night.  I tasted both the scallops and salmon and seriously couldn't say which was more exquisite!  A bit loud, but definitely some fantastic food.  Credo is on the map and a place I we will look forward to on every trip to San Francisco.  Big "wow" for Credo. 

We returned to Credo with the highest expectations. Thankfully Credo was as good as we remembered. We enjoyed the porchetta pork shoulder and the chicken involtino - both were delicious.  If I had to chose, I'd say the chicken was my favorite.  Love the food and we'll be coming back again!
author: Doug D.

description:
Service was good, our waiter was honest and knowledgeable.

My issue with Credo is the value. My $18 risotto was a light drizzle of food that could almost be sopped up with a piece of bread. Very unsatisfying. Almost so tiny a portion that it could be a joke.  The pasta dishes we had were equally small and VERY salty.  The waiter kindly admitted that he's heard that complaint from other diners.  Hopefully, they can present more fulfilling portions and cut back on the salt. The dishes can flourish without it
author: S K.

description:
After reading some of the reviews listed here I was prepared for spotty service, but my colleague and I were pleasantly greeted by a very attentive person who brought us our drinks and talked about the menu. Evan, our waiter for the rest of the evening was charming and amazing. He was off-the-charts customer service. The food was great but having him a our waiter is a total reason to go back again very soon. Wish all waiters could be like that. Thanks, Evan!!!
We had a fabulous meal - fried asparagus was outstanding, the goat cheese was amazing, kale salad, the 1/2 chicken, dessert, great libations as well. Kudos to the kitchen. We practically licked our plates clean.
 yummmmmm!
author: Rita F.

description: Wonderful food. The sea bass was excellent! I love the decor it has positive I believe...statements all over the walls. The service was excellent and I'm excited to come back and enjoy more deliciousness.
author: Shondra G.

description: I would have given it 5 stars but it was rather noisy, so the ambiance was not ideal. But everything we ordered was so yummy. We had the burrata (perfect), the chopped salad, the garganelli pasta and the proscuitto pizza. I would definitely go back in a heartbeat. Loved it!
author: Kerri B.

description: Enjoyed it very much. The server was a bit awkward but the food was delicious. Margarita pizza, Brussels sprouts and potatoes, shrimp appetizers were great. I had the halibut as my entree, though it was good, it was a little on the small size. Besides that, my water was always full.
author: Richard G.

description:
I know what you're thinking ... this place has an average of 3.5 stars and yet I, who rarely gives out high ratings, have given it 5? What gives?

I thought it was great. They did everything right:
-- Getting seated was easy and we didn't have to wait. Check!
-- Our waitress brought out water, menus and bread very quickly. Check!
-- The bread was warm and tasty. Check!
-- We ordered some wine, and the waitress brought it over quickly. And it was the right one. Check!
-- We ordered the Fonduta del Bosco and it was gloriously flavorful. Check!
-- We ordered more wine. (they don't get more credit for this one)
-- We decided to share the Sedanini after seeing a couple of them pass by and the waitress telling us it's a "signature dish". It was delicious. Check!
-- We ordered more wine ... (again, no extra credit)
-- And when the bill came, I didn't have a heart attack!

And to top it all off, it's a cool little restaurant with quotes on the wall and a large bar in the center of the room, yet it maintains coziness with lighting and decor.
author: Akash K.

description:
Quote on the wall of Credo:
"I believe in white supremacy until the blacks are educated to a point of responsibility. I don't believe in giving authority and positions of leadership and judgment to irresponsible people." - John Wayne

I like most of the quotes in here and see what they're trying to do by putting an array of unique and diverse 'credo' quotes on the wall. But it's 2014 and I feel as though there should be some sort of standard in a restaurant of not putting up quotes that would make some of their patrons extremely offended and uncomfortable. i brought it up with the hostess and she gave a half hearted shrug and didn't seem too concerned about the terribly racist quote sitting at eye level in front of the table. Seems like a huge oversight to me and I'm surprised to see something like this, particularly at a restaurant in SF. Food is good, but not good enough that I'll ever be coming back.
author: Annie R.

description:
Wasn't quite sure what to expect -- seems like Credo is a complete hit or miss for folks. I admit, the 1000-point open table reservation totally drew me in. A solid experience for sure, but nothing super memorable or unique about the place.

Came in with a girlfriend for Friday night dinner, the place was about half full. Wine was quite good, but their by the glass selection is pricey, beware! I opted for the chicken stuffed with prosciutto and mozzarella. When it arrived, it was luke warm. The were super gracious and offered to make me a brand new dish, and offered me a comped salad/soup while I waited. Our server also comped our 2nd round of drinks.  Totally appreciated the graciousness! 

Would happily come back if in the area. A solid date night / casual dinner spot any day of the week.
author: Brianna M.

description:
Credo has a nice vibe and decor. You can keep yourself entertained by reading the hundreds of quotes (credo-statement of the beliefs or aims that guide someone's actions) on the wall which is cool. I guess they have taken the theme of the quotes all the way. I was started to hear someone talking loudly when I went to the restroom only to realize that it was a montage of speeches on the sound system.

I started off with an Italian lager which was good on an usually nice warm day in the city. The buratta honey crusting was very good. The filet mignon was a disappointment however. I asked if medium would be bloody since I did not want bloody. The waitress said it would not be bloody. And when I got the steak, lo and behold, it was bloody and a little chewy. I did not have time to wait for it to get fixed and just ate it. The spinach and  potato side that came with it was just OK. 

The chocolate ganache was pretty good. Our waitress describe it as a s'mores for adults and that was pretty accurate I enjoyed it. It was a decent dinner overall.
author: Sunil R.

description: I can't speak highly enough for how accommodating our server and the kitchen staff were for my wife's gluten sensitivity. They were so careful and went out of their way to substitute ingredients that might have contamination. The food was wonderful and she felt fine afterwards. The cocktails were great!
author: J E.

description: Met as we walked in the door by smiling helpful staff. Sat quickly and offered drinks and water. Drinks were served quickly, order taken with special requests honored. The chopped salad was excellent. The half chicken was well seasoned and moist. The tagliatelle with bolognese well sauced and tasty. A good choice for good food served by good folk at a reasonable price.
author: Jack J.

description:
I have been to Credo twice for dinner, I really like it. My most recent visit I had the beef rib which was just brilliant. Absolutely tender and extremely tasty. I have never ordered a pasta dish, I probably should at one point.

The service was good, I got comped a drink when my drink order took too long. Wasn't even absurdly long, this was above and beyond.

Desserts may be the highlight, we shared 4 different ones and all but 1 was excellent IMO. Even the one that I didn't really care for was well received by someone else, so all and all really pleasing.

Will definitely come here again.
author: Jim S.

description:
The octopus carpaccio and the clams app were both great. We had the bucatini with pork ragu next and that was just ok. We then had the osso buco and it was fine until we got to the polenta that was blended with arugula. It was SO bitter that would couldn't eat it. We told our server and she said she will let the kitchen staff know and walked away. Obviously customer service isn't their strong point here. For dessert we had the profiteroles filled with vanilla gelato. They were nothing special. Basic cream puff fill with gelato instead of cream.

The apps started out strong but lost us when the next courses arrived. I like that they make almost everything in-house but execution and service just didn't come thru.
author: Andy W.

description:
Stumbled upon Credo with the bf on a Saturday evening. We were planning to go to Tadich but that was packed so we walked around looking for plan B. So there were were sitting at the bar at Credo. The ambiance is very modern and has all these cool quotes on the walls. We were feeling like some bubbly, so the bartender recommended a really good champagne. We started off with the baked mussels which were nice. I ordered the scallops over squid ink risotto. This was the dish of the night! The scallops were cooked perfectly, a tiny bit raw in the middle and that risotto was so good we wanted to lick the plate. The other dish we ordered was the veal. That was very good too. I saw someone else at the bar order the sedanini. Looked amazing and so that's on my to-eat list next time I come back. 

The downstairs has a nice private room that you can book for parties. I thought about reserving this place for my friend's bday but I wasn't too keen on the limited menu for large parties so decided against planning a dinner party there. Something quirky - there are recorded speeches playing in the restrooms. When I went in there, I think it was Roosevelt. My bf said he got Mike Tyson. LOL!
author: Liv A.

description: The porchetta was incredible. Fork tender and full of flavor of candied orange and herbs. mmmmm.
author: Mark M.

description:
On NYE, I tried Credo.

The ambiance of the restaurant is modern, roomy, with bright lights all around.

We first split an arugula salad with a balsamic vinaigrette dressing and goat cheese. It was tasty but nothing really too memorable.

I ordered one of their seasonal dishes: the lemon prawn fettuccine- which was delicious. The portions were just right, and I have to point out that I did receive a good amount of prawns too! So I was really pleased about that. 

He ordered the Bay Scallops- which were seared to perfection and he received probably between 4-6 of them. The scallop dish was served with a brown sticky rice, but had more of a savory taste to it then the known sweet flavor.

Drinks were also delicious: I ordered the cucumber gimlet- refreshing!

I would consider going back to Credo but after having waited 30-45 minutes for our entrée, I admit I do have some hesitation in doing so.
author: C M.

description:
Wow! Credo had such mixed reviews I didn't know what to expect but I do appreciate all the GREAT tips and reviews from other yelpers! That helped me and my hubby order just the right food and I can tell you I definitely want to go back!

I was at the Wine and Canvas hosted at Credos and we decided to go earlier for dinner at Credos first - am so glad we did that!  Their fresh bread with fresh olives and garlic was SO fresh and delicious!!  I easily could've stuffed my sell just on that!! Not sure why one reviewer complained the bread was bland - you're supposed to eat it with the fresh olives - if it had flavor it would've taken away from the olives and garlic!

We then ordered the Rucola salad! Oh my! LOVED the poached pears and that Cowgirl Creamery Goat cheese was PERFECT together with the baby arugula! Was VERY light on the vinaigerette which was PERFECT so we could enjoy the goat cheese with the poached pear with a "touch" of the vinaigerette...  I could've eaten that as a meal... there was ALOT of the goat cheese and pear - so perfect to share with my hubby.

I ordered the Sedanini - LOVED the way they brought it out and it was SO DELICIOUS!!  with the baked bread on top that was seasoned so I could dip into the sauce... it was wonderful - along with the tasty homemade calabrese!!  BUT I have to say - I LOVED my hubby's dish even more!  He had the Maiale Osso Buco!!  That was HEAVENLY! so tender and flavorful with the delicious creamy polenta.   I want to go back to order that!!  The only issue my hubby had was it was too small of a serving.

My girlfriend ordered the Bucatini al Ragu di Maiale - and that was absoluted delicious - the noodles, sauce, meat - VERY yummy - so now I have to go a 3rd time to order that!  My other friends ordered the Raviolone aperto di pesce - and I didn't try it but both girlfriends who ordered it couldn't stop raving over it!  Because it's an open fased raviolone - they said it was like a seafood stew with pasta and they went for it with a spoon to get every morsel and sauce!!  OK.. now I need to go a 4th time!! 

We had to rush off - unfortunately the kitchen was slow and we didn't get our food in enough time to run off to the Wine and Canvas - so we had to pack about half of it up.  The server was nice enough - she knew we were going to Wine and Canvas and I wished she came to check on us earlier to order - because we had to wait a bit - and then the kitchen was backed up - would've been nice to put a rush on our order...

If you go early - it's worth it - we were there as they opened so parking was a breeze and got seated fast... just took a while to take our orders and get the food but next time we'll make sure we have more time to just relax and enjoy the meal and the company.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
We came for lunch and were not disappointed.
Yes, lunchtime is crazy busy but if you have a reservation, you'll do okay.
It was loud and everyone was running around crazy busy but we were not ignored and we were served fairly quickly.  Our waiter was awesome!  He made good suggestions for the wine we had paired with our lunch.  We had the burrata appetizer and caprese salad to start. Both delicious and fresh!  My entree was the orecchiette with spicy sausage. The pasta was perfectly al dente.  Just the right amount of food.  My husband had the linguine with clams which satisfied his craving.  We will be back for dinner...
author: Lisa N.

description: I've never been to the brick and mortar Credo, but have had their chopped salad delivered numerous times. Their chopped salad is the best in the city with each bite carrying all the flavors and textures of each meticulously diced ingredient. I always ask for extra vinaigrette because it is so delicious I want each bit of the salad to have some.
author: Gail N.

description:
Came in with a group of 25, so that's my disclaimer.

Service was fantastic, drinks were brought out as soon as they were ordered and everyone got their food at the same time. However, we didn't really get any appetizer in the form of bread, until later on in our seating. And I mean, later on to mean an hour into seating. However, the bread was fantastic! My criticism for that would be the butter came out hard and cold, or room temp and spreadable.

Next criticism is the drink and drink prices. For the amount paid for a glass of wine 11-16$, I expected more. I had to baby my wine to make it last through service. Furthermore, my acquaintance ordered a drink that tasted completely vile - we ended up sharing it around the table to pique everyone's palette and no one liked it. It was something that tasted like a BBQ pit.

And lastly, my linguine was soooo salty. Another acquaintance sitting across from me is an exchange student from Spain, and she asked me if this was how pasta was normally treated in America, with seawater in the sauce. Needless to say, most of us were embarassed.

For the price, I wouldn't come back. It's a nice, quiet little restaurant with probably very good food. We just didn't order what was good.
author: Ari F.

description: I'm a vegetable lover so the second I saw the options of small plates I fell in love! I ordered the roasted potatoes, Brussels sprouts and the trout as an entree, needless to say I will definitely be a returning customer. More importantly, the service is absolutely stellar here. Every member was genuinely caring and attentive and made my experience at Credo a 5 star!
author: Jen H.

description:
Just came back from lunch. 

1. Peak lunch hour, sat at the bar with my two friends. "Peak" meaning that the hostess noted to us that all of the tables were already reserved (except 4 tables remained un-seated for the next hour while we ate at the bar). I am not really against sitting at the bar, just a point about service.

2. Seated at the bar, where there is a bartender, who poured our waters and then had to be flagged down for every other possible step along the way - menus, ordering, bread.

3. Too-tart lemonade - when you mix by hand and don't really know the recipe, test it first. I won't be mad, I promise. My girlfriend and I had perma-pucker for the rest of the meal, and I enjoy a tart beverage, but it was a bit excessive. 

4. No bread! Bread was clearly offered to every other table, and I had to signal a jumbo jet just to get some bread once our salads came...

5. ...35 minutes into us sitting there. Ahi Tuna Salad and 2 ($15) Caesars with Chicken. Ahi - ok, Caesars, really just one of the most appalling salads I have ever had, and I didn't know it was really possible to wreck something so simple that badly. Chicken 'breast' (?!?) - dry and skin on and just not at all what you expect; the flavorless ends of romaine you usually reserve for your rabbit and a bland dressing (anchovy, not so much). 

Unfortunate.
author: E. P.

description:
My friend Ryan and I hadn't seen each other in years. He'd been off traveling the world...and my world consisted of long hours in an office. We decided we were overdue for a visit!

We met at Credo- which was reasonably open and airy for a Friday night. I loved the decor and ambiance of this place. Modern, roomy, well-lit, with fun quotes all over the walls. I wonder if Credo gets a lot of first dates...and thus feels responsible for conversation topics should conversation lag. I don't know...but it sure kept me occupied while I waited for Ryan to arrive.

Our server was super friendly and the drinks were awesome...though the food struck me as lack-luster. 

Want to meet for a drink? I'm there! Dinner? Meh.
author: Annalise F.

description:
I give a lower rating because of bad service. We were a table of 10 and we had to call for service every time. Drinks to apps to food.

But the food was good. The octopus in the apps menu was the best followed by the Barrata.
All the food looked good but the lamb dish was huge . The Gelato with Espresso was the dinner for dessert.
author: Sid B.

description:
LIke most places I rate as A-OK in San Francisco, 3 stars is a bit of a slap in the face in my opinion.  The bar is just set so high in a restaurant mecca like this that if a place doesn't come fully correct, it's a disappointment because I know I could have had such a better meal somewhere else.  

That sums up my meal at a team dinner we held at Credo.  We ordered a bunch of appetizers for the table, with things like hummus and mushroom fondue.  The fondue was good and definitely the best of the bunch and that says a lot from me since I'm not much of a mushroom fan.

I got one of their wood-fired pizzas, the shrimp fra diavolo and it was ok.  The crust was a bit limp but the toppings were pretty good.  I would have expected a bit more heat given the name of the pie, however.  In looking at others entrees, one that stood out in a negative way was the scallops.  Three scallops that didn't look all that well seared doesn't seem like it cuts it at the price I saw on the menu.

Service was attentive and friendly and the atmosphere is quite nice so, high marks there.  That's not enough to get me back for any more than drinks at the bar in a city like San Francisco though.
author: Tom C.

description:
This place is amazing and deserves more stars on Yelp.  I love the interior with all the phrases, quotes, and words thoughtfully sized, grouped, colored and placed on the wall!  The bathroom had little box framed newspapers of the "Credo" and were very creative.  I really love the interior of this place, high ceilings, and how the bar is set in the middle.  If I had a living room designed like this place, it would be perfect.
 
We had a reservation at 7:30p but the people were taking awhile so we were offered glasses of prosecco on the house.  It was pretty good.  The hostess and server were competent and efficient.  Our server, Joseph, was very attentive and accommodating.  We had the Ficchi pizza ($15) as an appetizer and it had balsamic vinegar, arugula, cheese, caramelized onions and some great mission figs on top.  The bread was perfectly soft even though it is thin crust.  I was really impressed (Pizza Antica in the South Bay tastes like cardboard compared to here)!  The complimentary bread and olive/garlic oil were also delicious (we ate a lot of carbs that night).  We had the Sedanini ($24 - big huge bread pie with pasta goodies inside) and it was like opening up a present!  We both gasped when the dish came out and the other tables were looking since the dish was so huge (it was bigger than a standard piece of paper and taller than the wingspan of my palm).  It was a marinara pasta with strips cured pancetta (NOM) and sausage.  A little dry but we loved the presentation!  

We also ordered a side of broccolini and it was delicious!  It was perfectly cooked and had garlic chips on top.  For dessert, we had the three huge, beautifully presented profiteroles with vanilla ice cream and salted caramel.  The ice cream was placed inside the profiterole like an ice cream sandwich and the salted caramel was drizzled on top.  It was perfect.  

After this dinner, we want to come back again!  We were talking about coming back again as we were eating our dessert.  It was THAT good!  Bravo, Credo!
author: Chris L.

description: I'm love to sit at the bar read all the quotes and eat a quick meal.  Salads are awesome and bartenders very attentive.  My go to place after a long day at the office .  Recommend for great service, quiet atmosphere and good food.
author: Karen A.

description: We always enjoy dining at Credo and our experiance this week was fantastic, sampling specialties from their new small plates menu. In the spirit of crab season, we couldn't get enough of the linguine with lemon & crab, and the ricotta meatballs with polenta were outstanding. Even though the restaurant was bustling, we got excellent, friendly service from Sabrina, and even Brandon, the new resaurant manager was making rounds to greet all guests. We definitely recommend Credo for any occasion!
author: Janette M.

description:
DON'T EVER STEP FOOT IN THIS PLACE

After leaving my credit card there, it should be a simple process to get the card back. Not at Credo...bartender instructed someone else to sign out the tab and send him with the card. No wonder the manager couldn't find it when I called. 

Dishonest establishments don't deserve your business.
author: Jason W.

description:
Cool art wall and spacious, great for a date or even a big group. The server is very friendly and accommodating. Noise level is great, not too loud, even though the restaurant was packed.

The bread and butter that they give us is sooo good, warm and soft just like what bread should be. I hate those cold french bread with butter.

I ordered the ORECCHIA DI ELEFANTE CON TOSCANELLI CIPOLLINE E POMODORINI, which is pork chop fried in clarified butter and comes with some cannelinni beans, tomato, and basil. The pork chop is super big (reflects the dish name - elephant's ear, I guess) but very tender and the salad on top has a good amount of acidity. I think the dish tastes good, but certainly not off the hook.

Will come back though, I love the space.
author: Novalina N.

description:
We celebrated the new job of a mutual friend here. (Check out their private party venue) The  hostess chose the pairings of some of the menu appetizers and drinks.
I loved the ancini, cheese and antipasti, and salad offerings. I loved the sparkling wine, red wine varietals and found my new favorite mixed drink, the Kentucky Buck (an amazingly smooth bourbon mixer) memorable & a great welcoming party  place.
author: DS K.

description: This place is just ripe for Gordon Ramsey to come in and give it a slap in the face -- and I"m no fan of Gordon Ramsey.  It could be so much better with a little attitude adjustment by the staff and having the chef taste some of his own food before sending it out.
author: James S.

description:
Came here for a dinner with my co-workers after work one day with a gift card we had won in a competition and we spent the entire giftcard plus more! We thought we were on a huge budget so we ended up going a bit overboard to say the least haha. 

We started out with 2 bottles of wine for the table - one pinot noir and one zinfandel. I don't remember the specific name of either but they were both delicious! In addition to that, we ordered EVERY single one of the appetizers (that's not a joke). I'm a vegetarian so I had a bite of every single one of those. The ones that stood out to me were the goat cheese and the burrata cheese. The combination of the goat cheese and the apricots on top of a slice of bread was a delicious combination! I absolutely love burrata cheese and the one at Credo was topped with honey, or some sweet syrup like that and it tasted great. I really enjoyed both of the cheeses and highly recommend them. They also serve bread and butter as a starter so you will never run out of bread to eat with the cheese.

For my entree, I ordered the mushroom risotto. The server recommended that over all the other vegetarian options because he said it was the most flavorful of them all and I would agree with him that it had a multitude of flavors. There were large mushrooms and some green vegetables mixed in with the risotto and the whole dish was topped with some tasty herbs. I really enjoyed it and recommend it!

Even though my stomach was full beyond words, we decided to order 3 desserts to share for the table: the creme brulee, the chocolate ganache, and the pot de creme. The creme brulee was served warm with fresh berries on top and was so delicious! The chocolate ganache was made with very rich chocolate and had a whipped cream topping - the combination of the rich and light flavors made it extremely satisfying. Lastly, this was my first time trying pot de creme and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I am a huge caramel lover so that might be part of the reason, but it tasted like a less heavy caramel custard (I enjoyed the texture of this more than that of caramel custard). 

All in all, we had a great time at Credo, but just a tip, this place does get a little pricey if you want to go all out. I would recommend coming here for some sort of occasion or celebration!
author: Malika R.

description:
I dined here a few weeks back with friends after work. It was easy to get a reservation without much notice. The walls are covered with quotes, which I loved.

 I had the Whole Wheat Pappardelle and it was excellent. Our server, Tim Rawls, was excellent and made us feel very welcome and at ease. He gave us reccomendations on both food and drink. I would definitely reccomend this place for dinner or drinks.
author: Camille D.

description:
Came here for Dine About Town 2011 Lunch with reservations at 12.45pm. We arrived a bit early and was seated right by the cash register when there was another two person table right next to it. The lady who prepared our table was very warm but the other guy in the gray suit was very pretentious! Eh! 

This place reminds me of a nicer, fancier, more hip diner. The kitchen was open to the dining area. I actually hated this. This isn't Korean BBQ! I smelled after eating there. The decor is very hip and modern. They had quotes on the walls in these vibrant colors. 

It took the waiter a bit to introduce himself. AND they ran out the soup on the Dine About Town Menu. It was like 12.30 for god's sake! How can you run out of the soup?!

First Course
Credo "Misticanza" Salad with Chianti Vinaigrette - What a cheap way to have a fixe price menu. It was just some lettuce and some bits of carrots tossed in a vinaigrette. I could have made this.  

Second Course
Seared Skirt Steak with Roast Potatoes, Beet Greens, and Natural Jus - Medium rare. Nothing special about this dish. It was what it was. Good but not amazing. Being Chinese I love veggies, I think they assume most of their customers don't like greens so their Beet Greens was over-seasoned. Overpowered the taste of the greens. 

Credo Lasagna with Bechamel and Bolognese - My friend ordered this. Sadly to say, this was the first time I tried Lasagna. It was good but I would not pay 17 dollars for lasagna. My friend enjoyed it but like my steak it was good but not amazing. 

The bathroom is down two flights of stairs. One men and one women. Very very plain bathrooms. Clean though. 

I would not be coming back, the experience wasn't horrible, it was just very mediocre. Our waters was refilled in the beginning of our dining experience but neglected the second half. I rather spend my money somewhere else.
author: Sarah C.

description:
So... my husband works in the financial district so I figured we should have a lovely Friday night meal at a neighborhood joint so we could go right after his workday. I was looking to have some seafood and thought hey, would like to have some linguini with clams and as a bonus find some place with octopus and voila! Credo had both and had open reservations on OT. 

To start, we had the octopus and brussel sprouts appetizer. To my surprise, my honey LOOOOOVED this dish. I am usually the octopus fanatic but he loved it so much, he commented that he would bring his foodie friends to come try it. It's got a nice char on it and sautéed with a bit of a kick to it. Would go great with beer but I didn't wish to drink that night so couldn't tell you from experience but some day I plan to! 

We also had the buttermilk fried asparagus - very nice! Breading was light and not greasy, aioli was lemony and refreshing to offset the fried aspect. 

For entrees, I had the seafood linguini with tomato based sauce which was tasty with perfectly cooked pasta. My hubby had the garganelli with chicken/proscuitto meatballs and he enjoyed it very much. I had a bite and it was perfectly cooked al dente and loved those english peas! All we can say is that every plate was eaten clean! Nothing left behind. 

Even though we were full, we managed to squeeze in some gelato! Our waiter recommend the caramel salted gelato and it was fantastic. 

What a wonderful neighborhood gem for the financial district! We will definitely be back for more! For sure, he will be for that octopus!
author: Kuishingal F.

description:
People seem to flock to this place, because it's the only place in the area that will take reservations for big groups. I came on a Saturday for my friend's birthday party.

While me and a couple of other friends were waiting for people to arrive, we ordered some drinks. The drinks took forever to come out even though the restaurant was pretty empty. The waitress also gave my drink to the wrong person. We were hungry and asked for some of the bread and it was pretty mediocre. Just un-toasted french bread with butter.

For appetizers, we had the burrata and the octopus with brussel sprouts. The burrata was pretty good, the octopus was just okay. 

For my main dish, I really wanted the sedanini alla credo whIch seems to be what everyone raves about on yelp... but my waitress said they stopped making it 2 years ago... Instead, I had the orecchiette, which was a very basic pasta with marinara sauce. I told my boyfriend that I could even make this (and I don't cook). The pasta tasted fine. I really liked the texture, it was hard and chewy. And I guess it's partly my fault for not ordering something that was more interesting. Portion sizes were pretty small. My boyfriend was still hungry after having his clam linguine dish.

Later, we brought in a cake for our friend's birthday and they charged a $3/slice cutting fee for that. For a group of 12, that turned out to be $36 which is pretty ridiculous.
author: Christina L.

description:
They were A M A Z I N G!!! Super friendly, every detail was great, and every dish was delicious-especially the Caramel Pot!

A MUST GO EAT!!!!
author: Taen B.

description: Eaten lunch here 7 times, it's our team's go-to lunch spot because it's casual, good food, and quite frankly just a few blocks from the office. We've had a group of as many as 9 people to only 2 people. There is nothing fancy in the menu in my opinion only, it's California/Italian. Never had a bad experience with the staff or the food. I am super surprised by the bad ratings.  There was only one time that service was slow, and when it was, I just let our server know that there's a 25% tip awaiting ...that got her attention fairly quickly. It's true that bathrooms are downstairs in the labyrinth.
author: Al G.

description:
Went there last Friday night for dinner. I agree the food is a bit pricey for casual dining, but the food was solid and the Sadanini alla Credo is a must try - heaping bowl of rigatoni pasta with sausage baked underneath a thin layer of pizza dough. 
Our server, Amanda was super friendly and attentive....did not miss a beat while handling multiple table. 

Will be back!
author: Mimi T.

description:
Great bottle and by the glass list however prices are more than double on some so you'd be better off paying a corkage fee. The philosophy behind the restaurant is clearly seen on the walls and through the soundbites in the bathrooms = fun.

Service was fine. Plating was a disaster. We ordered a lot of food for just a few people and it was broken into two courses only; two salads, bread + olives , mushroom fondue + flat bread and a beet pizza all out at the same time. The tomatoe/arugula/mosh and burrata salad was very good and my favorite dish of the evening. Problem, I want to enjoy the company of those around me and slowly eat my salad, unfortunately by the time I get to the pizza and fondue it's barely warm and particularly for the fondue, difficult to eat (glob of cheese). 

Second course, I had the hand rolled pasta with broccolini, it was pretty good. For dessert, profiteroles trio which was delicious.

The location is a bit rough, not much going on in the neighborhood and far out of the way just to eat there, would return for lunch if I were downtown but not otherwise.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: We found this gem on Yelp-only 5 blocks from our hotel. Definitely a local place, and we loved it. Atmosphere is cozy and close with superb service. The food was outstanding-the wife ordered the steak and I had the chicken garganelli. We will definitely be back next visit!
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Dear Credo & Trycaviar.com, 

If your restaurants can't deliver due to high volume, perhaps you should just remove them or show them unavailable. Or they should reconsider belonging if they can't handle the volume.

In the meantime you can tell Credo they're losing in house diners as well as future orders when I have to wait until already deciding what I want to order to find out they've chosen not to participate...besides saying their next delivery time is 8:30-9:30. Hardly doubt they'll be busy then considering SF dining hours.

Smooth move...I won't even say the rest.
author: Nora L.

description:
Fine, but I wasn't blown away by my experience. If half stars were an option I'd give it a 3.5. We had an early lunch reservation for 4, and the restaurant was practically empty when we walked in (around 11:15 on a weekday). The table bread was good, but not great. We had the burrata as an appetizer, and I loved it. Great idea drizzling it in honey! There was a lot of cheese, easily enough to feed 3-4 people, unless you have a major cheese addiction. 4.5 stars for this dish!

For my main I was torn between the pizza special of the month (I remember that it had gorganzola and pears), and the bucatini. With the cold weather that has been rolling through recently, I went with the pasta thinking that a warm heavy dish would match the weather well. The restaurant has huge front windows, so it felt a little drafty. When my pasta came, it seemed like it had been sitting out for a bit - very room temp. The portion size was not huge, although after my round of burrata I was still only able to eat half. For an italian restaurant having only so-so pasta, I'd give 2 stars. The sauce was good, but I was underwhelmed. 

Service was a mixed bag - really great with the water refills, but our waiter was slow to take orders and change out the courses. We did order a small dessert for the table, and the entire lunch ended up taking over 1.5 hours. 

I'd definitely go back, but I plan on trying the pizza next time.
author: Eve D.

description:
The food tastes fine but its small portions and overpriced. Service is also a little slower than desirable. 

I've been here a lot for work lunches but always bemoan the experience: for example, a fish dish, app, and some bubbly water is 50 bucks. Its done competently, but the overall food experience (considering that) is meh.
author: Catt G.

description:
It was my birthday dinner for 13. 1 person couldn't make it, so make that 12.

My friends and I went out for dinner and drinks. Everyone at the table got a cocktail. I ordered my cocktail a little later than everyone else, but THEY FORGOT ABOUT MY DRINK ORDER. Dinner orders were significantly later and they didn't communicate to us that they were waiting for the last people in our party to show up, we would've said to order without them. 

We found that service was slow, and we had to prompt the waiters and waitresses to get things done. Some of them were even standing around as we were waiting for service.

I LOVED the ambiance was nice, and my group of friends were entertained by the quotes on the wall. The food was good, no complaints there.

HOWEVER, with slow service, we didn't get out until 9:45pm. It was perfect timing to get into Rickhouse (down the street), but annoying that we had to wait so long. I talked to another friend's mom who works in the area, and I hear that service is no different during lunch.
author: Christina L.

description:
Came here for a luncheon celebration with 15 coworkers.

The place was airy, open, and love the inspirational quote decor. We were seated in the basement. Room was a good size to host a private event. This was the only thing that they had going for them.

I was completely disappointed with their food. I ordered the burrata salad and shared the only 3 choices of pizza on their menu.   The burrata cheese on my salad was runny and the dressing was balsamic vinegar but tasted sweet.  I thought it was gross. I had 3 bites and gave up. The pizza was dull, bland and after you let it sit out, it was just hard and chewy.

Doubt I'll be back.
author: Diana M.

description: The noodles are homemade and delicious! I loved the decor of this restaurant, especially the Howard Stern quote, what can I same I'm a Stern fan. It was not busy during lunch (noon) and its in the middle of downtown so that was really nice, i was able to hear the person sitting across from me and we didn't have to yell. Its an open kitchen which i always find nice. Overall this was a great little lunch trip. Recommend!
author: Amy D.

description:
Nice restaurant in the Financial district.   On a Saturday night, it was not crowded. I assume it would be during the lunch hour period.   

Staff was very friendly and on top of the evening.  My friends and I enjoyed our meal and the wines we shared.  The food was very good. Californian cuisine.   I only feel sorry for the table that was next to us. As we were very loud during the evening. But being British, i think they are just uptight in general.

The  sweetbread dish was very tasty.   Lightly fried, it was crispy and delicate. My friend who never had sweetbreads, enjoyed it.   My entree was the steak with chimichuri sauce. Ordered rare, it was delicious.  

For my dessert, I had the tiramisu. It was heavy in taste, yet light in texture.  Very tasty.   So sinful that I  could almost finish it all, but I resisted.   

Overall, a very good restaurant to dine for dinner and lunch.  Definitely a come back place.
author: Marck N.

description:
"Feed the people."

An amazing little eatery hidden away in the empty streets of the Financial District.  This restaurant serves up some good eats.

Anna was our bartender for the evening and in her free time she entertained us with some bar-wisdom in making classic and classy drinks for the masses.  Her knowledge was unmatched and her cool while making the drinks was unrivaled.

We were shortly seated and starving so we ordered a little bit of everything, with a few more drinks to keep the fun going.  The Corstini Misti - AMAZING.  A little heavy on the Hummus but if I could have re-done my entire meal that night I would've ordered 5 plates of that Antipasti just for myself.  the rest of the food was great but nothing to write home about.  I will be back to try more things but for now Credo is a good contender on my list.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Credo is a TAD on the pricey side, but everything is excellent, though none of the items called out to me except maybe the hummus appetizer thing.. (YOU MUST TRY IT)

The decor inside is inspiring and different. You must also go to the bathroom.. they play inspiration speeches when you're in there taking a piss.

Overall, all items are great but not inventive - the pizza/dough/bread is HELLA good here though and I didn't have a problem with any of the food items I ordered.

Also.. near the back of the room where the kitchen is.. the floor is kinda slippery here, I think because it's oily. I almost slipped!
author: Emily C.

description:
I was up in SF recently for the AAPIP convenings (http://www.aapip.org/) and they arranged for a group dinner at Credo.  I liked the privacy of the dining room downstairs though the room didn't seem to absorb sound very well.  The AAPIP staff pre-ordered a family-style dinner.  The food was pretty decent, though nothing was too memorable other than our eating a whole lot of carbs!  :)  Service was good.

Anyhow, for that area of town, Credo is one of the more affordable options.  The staff will work with you to design a menu for your event that goes beyond what you may see on their regular menu.

Another plus?  They choose a local nonprofit -- a COMMUNITY PARTNER -- that benefits from a percentage of their proceeds every month.
author: Carol L.

description:
I've been here twice for happy hours, and both times I was impressed.  

The ambiance is great.  Nice, soft lighting and overall just a very nice space to be in. The drinks are off the hook!  The mixologists are AWESOME, and their concoctions are works of art! SO delicious! I cant remember the drink I got the first time I went, but I do remember really liking it.  The second time I went, the mixologist started us off with complimentary glasses of prosecco. So generous! Then I had a drink with basil in it, and it was INCREDIBLE and strong.  I don't know what it was called - I just told the mixologist that I liked basil-infused drinks, and she totally delivered.  After that second round, for some reason, the mixologist offered us a complimentary third round of drinks (!!!), but I was pretty buzzed by that point (their drinks are STRONG!), so I didn't get anything.  But I very much appreciated that offer.  Super generous! 

I haven't really tried the foods here, but I've eaten a pizza and their cheese plate.  I remember liking the pizza and being completely WOWed by the cheese plate.  We got 5 cheeses, and it comes with these amazing jams.  

I'd love to come back and try the rest of their menu someday.  I love the space, the drinks, the service, and the foods that I've tried.  It seems like a place that's appropriate for both casual dinners as well as special occasions. 

Oh, and also Credo partners with a different community organization/non-profit every month, and a portion of the proceeds during that month goes to support that organization.  How awesome is that? Love it!
author: Vivian C.

description: My team took me to lunch for my birthday. This restaurant is really wonderful. I ordered olives for the table and they had been marinated in oil and a spice and then warmed to bring out the flavor of the olives. Delicious! Others had spectacular pastas and, while I talked, they ate everything so fast that I had to shut up and catch up with my plate of mussels. Everything was so delicious. After they cleared the empty dishes, the waiter brought me a strawberry shortcake dessert because he heard it was my birthday. SO THOUGHTFUL! What a nice experience in the middle of the day! I will be bringing my Italian husband here soon for dinner! Also very happy to be seated downstairs at a large table where it was more quiet. Upstairs seemed a bit noisy but it was the peak of lunch hour. Wish I had more time to read the artistically and thoughtfully placed quotes on the walls. The menu was one of the most interesting I have seen in San Francisco, only topped by the fabulous preparation and taste of the food!
author: Twila E.

description:
Came here with a large group.  We were able to get an easy reservation and they were very accomodating.  I left a comment on our reservation and they noted that for our special occation.  Terrific service.

The food was above average for italian food.  Everything was good.  Not mind blowingly awesome but everything was good.   With our group of 10 people, everything came out terrific.  My friends especially loved the gnocchi and pizza.  I had the linguine with seafood.  Salads were very fresh.  They served sourdough with dinner.  

I must complement the bartender.  The cocktails were excellent and not too sweet.  

It's a great restaurant for groups. Very reasonably priced.
author: Sue L.

description:
We ame here for a company dinner:  

Green leaf salad - posssibly the best dish of the night -4 stars
Appetizers - spinach cheese ravioli (2 stars - it was bland) and mushroom risotto 4 stars very tasty)
Entree:  Salmon looked outstanding - unfortunately the fish was bland;  pork shoulder was just that - fatty two stars at best
dessert:  chocolate ganache - too bad it resemble more like a fudge - one star;  the other was creme de pot - okay 3 stars
author: Bill L.

description: It took me 2-3 hours to recover from salt bloat. Both the table butter and the red sauce on my ravioli = unbelievably salty. And I am usually into salt. No problems here with the service though.
author: Jaime B.

description: Tasty pastas and appetizers. Had the caprese salad to start and the beef ragu pasta for the entree. Both were good,but the pasta was a little salty. Good place for Italian, but too pricey for what it is.
author: Elveera K.

description: Ate here a while ago, the menu was not exciting and i didn't enjoy what i ordered.   It wasn't bad, but i'll probably not return.
author: Michael E.

description: This was a such a fun place!..My friends and I enjoyed the décor (we read the quotes on the walls and discussed some of them,laughed over others,and were touched by some).The staff was Super sweet,The manager (his name I think was Jeremy) came over to apologize because they were unable to make soup that day and sent bread over for us.Ok people let's talk food ..We were a group of four and ordered halibut,risotto,pasta with sausage and pasta with shrimp (I forgot the darn names).Every Single dish had an Amazing flavor!!..We couldn't stop eating each other's food and saying how good it was ..The desserts were Beautiful to look at and Yummy!!..We had pana cotta,milk and cookies (freshly made),gelato,and chocolate cake.We were celebrating a birthday (and the birthday boy got ice cream with a candle also without being asked!!).This place is definitely on my list to bring more friends to,if you haven't tried it,you're missing out!!!
author: Arti A.

description:
Absolutely no complaints about Credo. I had the garganelli and it was absolutely to DIE for. Portions may seem small when they first arrive; but the food is very hearty, and I wasn't even able to finish my dessert (a very generously sized creme brule). 

If you're looking for a nice night out with delicious food, good drinks, and good desserts, definitely go to Credo.
author: Marla J.

description:
"I believe" is the theme of the restaurant. Loved reading the quotes all over the walls and there was a good energy in the place on the Friday night I dined with my friends.

Bread was delicious, as was my Caesar salad, and seafood linguine. 

But what I will be coming back for is the s'mores dessert! One of my favorite desserts...ever. Think I'll get two next time because it was almost painful to have to share it. :)
author: Sami L.

description: My organization hosted a private event at Credo recently. The room - the Archive downstairs - was a great private spot, the staff were all very helpful, really going out of their way to make sure we were able to do everything we needed, and the food was delicious. Highly recommend for private events.
author: Dusie H.

description:
I had to make reservations some where downtown for a party of 8 and this place came up with the space to accommodate us. I had only been there for lunch before so it was hard for me to imagine what dinner would be like in their space. The space is definitely better suited for lunch and lacked intimacy. The food though was far better than expected. 

The burrata appetizer was excellent and the cheese was not too soft and milk and the honey was a great touch. I also had a chopped salad that was actually chopped unlike some other chopped salads I have had in the past. It had a great dressing on it and it was a decent size. I then had the salmon that was done perfectly. Our server wasn't the best in the planet but he did a great job on timing which was appreciated. I would go there again and no longer see it just as a lunch spot.
author: Kim M.

description: Had a good pear and gorgonzola pizza and nice cocktail.  The food was prompt and enjoyed by all.  Also had tasty short ribs and a side of white beans with nice flavor.  I liked the decor and would like to come back and try some other items on the menu.
author: Zillah T.

description: Great service and good food. I like bringing my consultants out here for lunch as they are pretty speedy and have a good food selection.
author: Yas G.

description:
Credo impressed me from the start! I had made a reservation for my family a couple of days previously, and we were immediately helped when we walked in. The hostess led us past the main dining room, past the kitchen, down a set of stairs and into a small, softly lit dining room with only a few tables. The walls were back-lit frosted glass covered in great quotes from famous politicians, musicians, and other important people. The room had its own bar (although not tended at the time) and its own server who checked with us consistently. The server was attentive, friendly, and probably the easiest to talk to of any server I've encountered. This was a plus as my parents are not used to any kind of dining other than the Olive Garden, and needed help with the fancier items on the menu.

The food was so good, I ordered an additional entree to take home and eat later! I got  a delicious spinach and tomato pasta which I relished, and I don't even like tomatoes. My boyfriend got butternut squash ravioli with brown butter sage sauce and pomegranate seeds which I found hard not to keep picking off his plate. So I compromised and ordered my own to take home. I don't eat meat and didn't try these, but my mother got the fish which she absolutely loved, and my dad got the steak, which is never cooked right no matter where we go so I won't include his opinion. 

I try to take my family to great restaurants when they come into town on precious few occasions, and this has by far been my favorite.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Ended up at Credo again last weekend as some friends joined us in the city last minute and we were able to get a reservation. 

We walked in and the place wasn't crowded, which I generally consider a plus. Dinner started with drinks. I had a gimlet, which I thought was excellent. Based on that drink + the others ordered by my party, I would come back here again for drinks.

That said, the food was good, but not great. Given the price point, I expect to be wow'd a bit more.  

If I could give it a 3.5 I would.  I've rounded down to a 3 given that food was the majority of my experience -- I would most likely give it 4 if I was taking into account just the drinks.
author: Madi B.

description:
I think the food and service here are both good. They have an excellent Chop Salad and tasty meatballs. I have always enjoyed what have sampled. It is however overpriced, especially at lunch. The portions and prices do not match.
Barbacco on California provides similar cuisine at a more affordable price.
author: Adrienne G.

description: Went to this lovely modern Italian restaurant with my coworkers after work. We made reservations a month in advance since it was our holiday get together. The food was exquisite! We started our night with a bottle of red wine.  They had a large selection of wines. One side of the menu was dedicated to wines! Ordered 3 apps. My fav out of three would probably be the meat balls. Who doesn't like meat balls?  As for my main dish, I ordered linguine. It had clams in garlic butter and white wine. That was delicious and they actually put a good amount of clams, they were small tho. And lastly, the dessert! Not sure what it was called, but it had the word s'mores in it. Very decadent! I wouldn't recommend for you to eat it my yourself. Definitely needed to be shared cuz of how sweet and rich it gets. Overall, I would definitely go again!
author: Ellen Z.

description:
I've been going to Credo for their happy hour for quite some time. I visited there yesterday afternoon, only to find that they have changed over to happy-less hour. 

I realize it's downtown San Francisco, but $3 off a $20 glass of wine doesn't really meet the happy hour criteria. I also had to hunt for the server to place a drink order. And the server served my red wine in a white wine glass, and to add insult to injury, did a short-pour on my glass of wine (who knew 3 ounces was the new "full glass")!? They also eliminated their happy hour food menu. 

Not to say that Credo doesn't offer a good lunch and dinner selection, but I was disappointed with the elimination of happy hour, not amazing service and being shorted on a standard pour of wine.

There are plenty of other wonderful places in the downtown area for happy hour, so I would suggest skipping Credo for other spots that have better offerings on this much needed after work pastime.
author: Justine P.

description:
The food is fantastic. Both times I've been here I ate really well, specially the burratta appetizer, but also the pizza and pasta. I love the concept of the restaurant, and the quotes all over the walls leave you with tons of stuff to read (and talk about) during your meal.

Service last time (dinner on a weekday, some free tables) was pretty bad, unfortunately. Extremely slow (some 20 minutes went by before we could order our food), but nice enough. I'd certainly recommend this place.
author: Bruno B.

description:
Situated in a brick building, I walked inside and was surprised by the extremely modern ambiance. Some might say that the quotes are lame, but I think it is a nice touch, especially "feed the people." Another plus would be the open kitchen which I have always been an avid fan of. Not only is it fun to watch the chefs put on a show, but also you know the kitchen will be much cleaner since everyone can look in. 

Moving onto food after ordering we were given complimentary bread; I would like to say it was french bread. It was presented on a simple wood board with salted butter. The bread, this is a weird comment, was really inconsistent because some slices seemed fresh and had a nice crunch while others seemed a day old. Also unfortunately it came out room temperature.. lame. Well to start my meal I ordered the kale salad which was accompanied by some oranges, carrots, and watermelon radishes all dressed up in a citrus vinaigrette. Believe I am no expert in salad, but I know a bad one when I have one. It was literally just some vegetables thrown on a mound with a little bit of dressing. It did not have any real flavor and honestly I could have an 8 year old do the same thing if given the ingredients. I was afraid that the meal would only get worse, but I was delighted by my main entree when it came out. I ordered the king salmon which sat atop a bed of potatoes, asparagus, chard, and was topped with a salsa rustica. The dish was nice and light with all the garnishes cooked and seasoned well. The cook on the salmon was delightful and had nice flavor especially when eaten with the salsa rustica. The "salsa" added a nice savory element to the dish and I gobbled all of it up quickly. For dessert I ordered the vanilla bean panna cotta with strawberries and cookie crumbs. The panna cotta was very good not being very sweet and the vanilla flavor really came through. Strawberries were a little sour in my opinion, but the cookie crumbs did add a nice little change in texture which was pleasant. The sauce that came with the panna cotta was a tad bit sweet so I didnt really bother eating it. 

Our server was nice and friendly when he came by, but I felt was not super knowledgeable and did not seem to really give us much attention. An old teacher joined me for dinner and we finished the bread relatively quickly. From that time, about ten minutes, to the time we got our appetizers he did not once visit our table thus we were left with an empty wooden board that took up 1/4 of the table. Also I thought there were nuts on the panna cotta before clarification and asked our waiter about it. He thought there was only to come back a couple minutes later telling us it was cookie crumbs. It is my personal conviction that if you work in the restaurant business, you need to know what you are serving otherwise you make yourself look bad and the customer skeptical about the establishment. 

All in all a nice modern italian restaurant. I would only go back to try a pizza possibly, but most likely not because of the tons of other great restaurants that my money can eaten by. Prices are a bit much, but what can you do since after all it is downtown San Francisco. 

Food: 3.5/5 Salmon was the only highlight
Ambiance: 3.5/5 Nice quotes, radio in the bathroom is weird though
Service: 2.5/5 Figure the menu out please
author: Mitchell L.

description:
Spaghetti Carbonara - this is the kind of dish that will always arrive differently depending on where you order it from...luckily, they make a fantastic version here.  The pasta was cooked to perfection and the sauce had the perfect amount of thickness and creaminess to it.  The pancetta was savory and full of flavor and the yolk added just a touch more of richness.

Before the meal we enjoyed some very good focaccia and tasty olives, which were perfect.
author: Ken G.

description:
Would have given 4 stars if not for the impressively bad attitude of the woman 'greeter' today.
I booked through the website's Open Table system and opted for 12.30. Arrived about 12.20 and was rudely told I'd arrived too early. When I said I believe I booked for 12.30 the rude hostess said told me in no uncertain terms, twice, that the mistake was mine.  There was a table by the window (as I'd requested in my booking) and the 'greeter' insisted on making my party stand in the entrance with no-one else around, for 10 minutes.  She then finally sat us at the table, which had been empty all this time, at 12.35.  Way to make her point!  Oh, the power!

Pity really because I brought my work colleagues for an important lunch meeting because I remember this being such a warm and welcoming place. 

The food was amazing. The chef brought out an extra serving of vegetables because he thought our order needed something extra...and the wait staff were good too.

I used to be a regular, but will certainly give it a good 6 months now before I try again. 
Perhaps by then the 'welcome' woman will have moved on and they will have someone who shows they are pleased to see me, and not be making a point that I have hugely inconvenienced them.

Just a suggestion!
author: sue-ellen s.

description: An amazing bar in the Financial District for after work quality food and drink with great ambiance. The HOT Irish bartender (Dara) mixes up a mean cocktail that will send you into a lively evening. Couple that with the octopus appetizer, wild mushroom risotto and consider yourself officially taken care of Yum to the nth!
author: Brooke H.

description: Great restaurant for a private affair of 20 people. Incredibly inventive menu and excellent wines. Timing was perfect for the dishes and service from Evan and waitstaff was brilliant.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Made a reservation, it was confirmed - when we arrived we were told there was a mix up and our reservation couldn't be upheld. The solution was sit at the bar or wait a few hours for the next reservation.  A simple call before we arrived would have prevented this review. Bad management means we won't be back.
author: Julia M.

description: Extremely mediocre.  Best part of the meal was the burrata cheese appetizer.  All else, over priced, lackluster and just blah.
author: Kerrie R.

description:
Great space, we came on the empty Labor Day weekend and had much of the restaurant to ourselves.

Buratta w/ honey ($9) w/ crostini. LOVED this. The honey drizzle is a brilliant touch.
Fried Padron Peppers ($7). Just ok. Like shishito peppers.
Caesar Salad ($10). Tastes like a Caesar.
Endive Salad with Figs & Gorgonzola ($12). Liked this more since I'm a fan of figs.
Strozzapreti w/ braised beef ragu ($18). Very meaty, and saucy. The pasta is a bit thicker, like a long noodle curled in upon itself. I wish it held the sauce more. A tad salty.
Ahi Tuna Special ($24). Light and tasty.
Honey & Pistachio Torrone ($7). It's a homemade ice cream with a rough texture. Would have preferred a smooth traditional ice cream or gelato texture.
Smores Special. Housemade marshmallow topped a dense brick of fudge. It was their interpretation of smores. Not quite. More a brownie or flourless cake.

Good service, party space downstairs if in search of group dining.
author: Cindy W.

description: This place is dead to me.. We waited an hour for our table of 6's order to come out. Most people at the table ordered gnocchi which only takes a few minutes cook. After 1 hour, they brought out the wrong order for a member of our table who didn't end up getting to eat at all! Dead to me.
author: Colton L.

description:
Came on a Saturday night after 6pm.  Easy street parking because the parking restrictions let up at 6pm.  Credo is nicely decorated and features large graphics of famous and not so famous quotations on the wall.  Credo isn't a super fancy place, but it is a nice place for Italian food.

Got reservations to sit at the chef's counter.  It's amazing to watch the two chefs at work.  Everything is so thought out in advance and they are so efficient.  There's no wasted movement and they are pretty much on the go all the time.  

Our hostess and waitress were very personable and gave us great service, as did all of the wait staff.  When things got slow, even one of the chefs had a chance to chat us up.  We really enjoyed sitting at the chef's counter to watch the action.  I think they'll take up to four diners at the counter.  

The heirloom tomatoes and mozzarella appetizer was fabulous.  The tomatoes were de-lish.  The chefs salad was just OK,.  The oreichette pasta with sausage and tomato sauce was very good.  The scallops were recommended to us and they were as good as advertised.  The accompanying corn, bean, and grains were very tasty.  The pizza with figs and caramelized onions  was also excellent.  I was surprised how good it tasted, and the crust was great.  

We finished off the night with salted caramel ice cream and a yogurt panna cotta with fruit.  Both were excellent.  

Great place for dinner.
author: Doctor G.

description:
(~)
- crab cake sandwich

(-)
- fries

Came during lunch time 12:30-1ish. The place is one floor and though it was busy we were able to grab two seats at the bar. Service was good, friendly waiter and our water was always refilled.

I ordered the crab cake which apparently comes in between buns like a sandwich (though you can opt to have it w/o the buns). The sandwich was just average, the crab cake was ok, nothing amazing. The fries it came with were terrible, very bland and dry.

Do not recommend this dish, especially with a price tag of 18 bucks. Might as well go next door to dillers and get a 7ish dollar sandwich or walk on over to wayfare tavern for some guaranteed yummy in your tummy.

This place is close to work so I may give it another chance and come back and try something else.
author: Julia S.

description:
A fun, casually elegant place to have dinner. "Credo" is Latin for "I believe" and the walls are filled with short statements by various famous (and not so famous) people beginning with "I believe..." It was fun to pass the time between courses reading statements like "I believe the first test of a truly great man is in his humility" (John Ruskin) and "I believe that newspapers will reach new heights" (Rupert Murdoch).

The service overall was quite good. When we arrived for our reservation, the hostess took us to a seat we did not like and we asked for a different table we saw open. She said the table was reserved, but when we pointed to a different table she offered us the first table we asked for, very graciously.

We started with the crostini misti with a trio of toppings: hummus, mushrooms, and kale. All three were VERY large portions. The appetizer could have easily fed 4 or 5 people. The highlight of the meal was the "Gnocchi al cinghiale": potato and olive gnocchi, wild boar ragu, and hazelnuts. I have dined with but never eaten a boar before, and it was truly outstanding. I asked where it came from and the waitress said it is raised in a natural habitat around Petaluma. So, I joked that it was actually "free range" rather than "wild."

After dinner I wanted to have an amaro so walked to the bar and looked at the two bottles they had. I asked the bartender what the difference was between them. He gave a brief explanation but then said the bar manager would be able to explain better. He flagged her down and she gave a nice description of the difference. I ended up getting the Amaro Montenegro on her recommendation, and enjoyed it so much I bought a bottle of it the next day at the wine shop in the Ferry Building.

I would definitely enjoy eating here again.
author: David Y.

description:
Great drinks. The Strozzapreti with Braised Beef Ragu and Parmesan and Steak were very good. 

The portions are small for the price.
author: Jon H.

description:
Complete great service and delicious food.

Me and my friend dined on a weekday 8pm.. Upon entering I usually check-in with yelp and noticed that Yelp had an offer for happy hour.  I asked Jennifer, our waitress and told me that happy hour is over but will check with the manager.. The manager came over and told us that the offer is for happy hour and also if we sat by the bar.. He then asked us if we would like to taste their cheese bread with hummus.. It was really great of him to offer us the free appetizer.  

While waiting for our food, the host noticed us looking at the wordings on the wall and started talking about the decor and was being a pleasant host.  Restroom is downstairs and noticed that they have private dining there as well for large group or something.  

Thin crust pizza bread topped with Parmesan cheese and hummus - blend of garlic, ginger, rosemary and other flavors.. very delicious and my friend not a big fan of hummus gave it a try and liked it.  They also brought in juicy olives to go with white bread.

Then Jennifer went through the specials and suggested the soup..  glad we ordered it.. Chicken and corn chowder - absolutely delicious.. creamy, not too thick consistent.  We were completely filled by this round.

We decided to share the pizza prosciutto.. about 8 slices.. thin crust pizza with ample amount of marinara sauce, cacio, shaved mozzarella cheese and prosciutto..   

It was a great dining experience and recommend it as a must-try place!
author: Hema K.

description:
Been here twice - once for a great wine and canvas event downstairs and once for lunch with a coworker.

The decor is modern and the quotes on the walls are fun to look at. he ambiance is generally quite energetic. The menu is fairly limited - everything is good but not outstanding. Service is very personable though.

The burrata appetizer was very good - the nectarine salad and the mushroom pizza were both just pretty good.
author: Jocelin L.

description: I've been there twice and I had a great time. The place itself is neat and very cute. The service is good and the food is just amazing. The dishes are definitely for one person. So, if you're hungry you might order two dishes for sure.
author: Dani B.

description:
Went here for Happy Hour - pretty good $8 small plates and beer for $4.  We tried an antipasti selection of meats: salami DeCacao, sweet coppa and mortadella and then we had the Pici Toscano - housemade pasta with flash-fried spinach (yum! this was a hit!!).  

Then we moved onto our entrees.  I got the Sedanini alla Credo - sausage, pancetta, vegetables, tomato sauce topped with pizza dough - quite a presentation (like a big poofy pot pie!) and very tasty!  We ate too many appetizers that I was too full to finish this, but my bf sure enjoyed it later!  

We also had the strawberry shortcake with balsamic and cheese (good, tasty, sweet strawberries).  

All in all, service was a-ok, the ambiance was interesting with all of the "I Believe..." quotes from various celebrities and historical people.  It was pretty good, good to try, pretty all right.
author: Maile N.

description: This place is fantastic. The service was phenomenal and the food was delicious. Went with a large group and ordered an insane amount of food. The burrata is seriously amazing. GET IT! Don't miss out on the meatballs either. They we're extremely juicy and the sauce was delicious. Love that they are served over polenta. The margherita pizza was very good, as well as the mushroom pizza. Loved the creme fraiche on the mushroom pizza. We had 5 pasta dishes that were all very good. My favorite was the risotto with crab. Dessert was also delicious. Absolutely loved the apple pie and tiramisu. Oh and be sure to order the Pimm's drink. That cocktail is probably one of the best cocktails I have ever had. It is so refreshing. Our server was Tim who was wonderful and knowledgeable. Brandon the GM was also so friendly and checked on us multiple times to make sure everyone was happy. Highly recommend this place!
author: Gabrielle C.

description:
I am beginning to wonder if Yelp isn't going to have to start letting us do half stars... it's just not granular enough, but anywho... I digress.  However this is a solid 4.

So in San Francisco for business for the week and was lucky enough to catch up with my better halfs aunt for dinner at Credo last night.  The place is really sharp, the quotes covering the walls are entertaining and well done (you could have just painted them, but the aplique is nicer) and the tables and decor in general are interesting and attractive.  We arrived early for a 7pm reservation and were seated immediately by the very pleasant host (who must have been the GM of the front of house manager).  One thing to be cognizant of - this place is loud.  The hard surfaces even with sound dampeners make every single sound amplify and bounce around the room.  That said it has good energy and it's still possible to chat... just not the place for a quiet dinner.

The wine list was short and sweet... I like to see some of the less typical Italian wines get some exposure and they had a couple of whites that you are starting to see but still don't get the cred they deserve.  My dining partner had not ever tried Friulano so the host very kindly brought her a taste (which she loved) and then quickly brought the bottle after he got the thumbs up.

The dinner menu like the wine list is pretty simple but very yummy.  We started with the endive salad which was beautiful in terms of color and presentation and was more than enough for one person.  For dinner she ordered the prawns and quinoa and I ordered the Bucatini (after agonizing between it and the gniocchi).  

The food came pretty quickly and the presentation on the prawns was fantastic!  They were all served whole and arranged in a row over the bed of quinoa. The quinoa had some type of herb in it that gave a nice green contrast with the orange/pink of the prawns.  The Bucatini was perfectly al dente and was highlighted by very bright and gardenfresh tomatoes.

We enjoyed ourselves very much and the  staff was very attentive and polite.  If you are in the FInancial District then it's a good spot for dinner.
author: Shane J.

description:
Went to Credo for a company event at lunch time. We tried everything on the appetizer menu. Yes, the burratta was very good, but after that it was downhill. All the other tems were so ordinary. Had the grilled prawns for an entree - 5 prawns and some quinoa with a sprinkle of arugula for $28! Good thing someone else was paying. For $28 for a lunch time entree, you'd expect something amazing.
As one of my colleagues said as we left - I've had better meals at Pasta Pomodora. Yep, that totally summed it up.
author: Carla B.

description:
(See pics)
